Ratings.comment: I absolutely loved his Law & Politics course. He provides so many opportunities for extra credit (just raising your hand) that your grade is a reflection of your effort. Daily reading quizzes aren't hard, very engaging lectures, and exams you can easily do well on. He gives real advice to students; every PoliSci major should take this course!

I'm not sure why others rated him so low... the majority of negative reviews are downright inaccurate evaluations. Kogan BY FAR is one of the best polisci professors at OSU with his extremely interesting and engaging lectures, great class structure (debate + guest speakers), and relevant reading assignments. He's knowledgeable and passionate!

I would not say he is a terrible teacher, he is not that bad but I wold say  pay attention and  make sure you understand because emailing him asking questions are not going to help. emailing him for help is a no go unless its a question about attendence or something along those line but question about midterms or final HE IS NOT HELPFUL.

Nice guy, interesting lectures, responds fast to emails, easy grader. Tons of extra credit and you can tell he wants you to do well. Midterm and final mcq is all from reading quizzes which are easy. Writing part of the midterm/final is long so start asap. 1 group project that you present in front of the class but grading is lax so don't stress

One of the best classes I have taken at OSU. The content was really interesting. This class has tons of extra credit. It is honestly really hard to get a bad grade. He had take home exams which he gave us two weeks to work on. He would also have multiple choice portions of the exams for which he would give us all the possible questions beforehand!

THE EXAMS ARE EASY: Multiple choice is a free 50%, and if you attempt each item on the rubric for the essay, you will receive another 25%.

Each time you participate in class or attend office hours, you receive one point of EXTRA CREDIT.

Best to go to office hours with a clear ask, he's hard to talk to.

Nobody understands politics better.
He literally might not be real.

Kogan is one of the most organized and intelligent professors I've taken thus far. It is fairly easy if you are interested in the material and do all of the daily readings. Exams are lengthy and tough but applicable and useful. I learned a lot.

I realized why he offers so much extra credit in class. He does in-class quizzes on Top Hat but manipulated the syllabus so that even if you have a valid excuse for missing the quiz and want to make it up you can't. The four "dropped quizzes" that he offers are a fraud, and my grade dropped after missing only two from an A to a B.

The information was engaging at times and the lectures were organized. Attendance is taken along with reading quizzes at the beginning of each class which could either hurt or help your grade. The exams were easy. The take-home questions required an in-depth ability to apply the material. Every time you speak you get a participation point.

Dr. Kogan is now of the most interesting and well-thought professors I have ever had. He is incredible knowledgeable and interested in his students success. The written exams are very long so make sure to start them early but he is a fairly gracious grader.
Spends all his time complaining online about unions and talking about how he deserves to make much more money than public school teachers.

Can't say enough good things about Kogan. Probably the most organized prof at OSU, responds in 2 minutes to emails, everything is very clear in syllabus. Can get extra cred for speaking in class, asks thought provoking questions. Exams are half take home, half online and aren't very hard. End of sem group project is engaging and fun. 10/10!

Very closed minded and hard to talk to. Some people just view themselves as too self important and he is one of them. You'll do well if you agree with him tho, just don't dare to have a differing opinion or outlook on a topic because MY GOD how dare you?!

Professor Kogan was the best professor I had during my time at OSU. He is really passionate about the subjects he lectures and keeps you engaged. His involvement in local politics and the examples he provides in class from his advocacy efforts prove that he cares about what he is teaching. 10/10!

Professor Kogan is really kind and extremely intelligent. He makes lectures easy to understand and always keeps them interesting. The downside of taking his class was that the readings are not easy and attending class is a must (otherwise your grade drops). The exams are also challenging and you have to plan ahead of time before starting them.

Vlad is a political scholar and is respected as such. You must show up to class everyday having read the assigned readings. Gives extra credit every time you go to office hours or participate in lecture.

Law & Politics class is a great option for anyone considering law school. There's lots of reading and exams (take home) take a few days to complete. This class is a lot of work but there are so many points available that you can miss a day or fail a quiz & get points elsewhere. It'll help you decide if law school is for you or not!

This man kogan is a absolute mad man do not take his class and Im saying this with a B. His group projects in a online setting is so stressful it feels like a dream thats how bad it is, his take home portion of exams are extremely long so do not try and do it the day before its due. Absolute nightmare and he does not care.

Super unaccommodating. I am in his class in the midst of the Covid-19 outbreak and somehow the class has gotten more annoying. He has a group project with 9 people so its impossible to meet and he doesn't give class time to do so and hasn' canceled it. There have also been at least 4 assignments not on the syllabus at all that he expects you to do.

This professor is rude, unapproachable, and grades harshly with unclear instructions. She assigns excessive busywork, reads off slides instead of teaching, and forces participation in 8 AM classes. Important details are hidden in modules, making assignments confusing. She relies on group work instead of real instruction. Avoid this class!

This course was on the lighter side as it consisted mostly of contribution to a final group project. Attendance was mandatory on TopHat and taken everyday, you could miss 2 before being deducted. There were readings before every class along with a quiz. Classes mostly consisted of group discussions and small group discussions.

Macaskill was incredibly interested in the subject, but at times can be boring. The class is surrounding one final essay that you submit paragraphs over the course of the semester, which is graded for primarily submission. The essay was challenging at times, but she grades easily. Overall a decent class if you need polisci credit.

The readings for this class are very interesting and engaging. Has the best interest for all her students and is more than willing to work with you on getting a good grade for the class. She has given out multiple opportunities for extra credit throughout the semester, and is very passionate about her teachings.
Cares about students, always willing to provide help to make sure students understand content. Open to listening to feedback. Would take a class with her in the future.

Goes off topic a lot, you can tell he just likes to hear himself speak. VERY inaccessible outside of class, he is an awful advisor too. Only reason I did not rate a 1 is because the class itself is semi-interesting.

Genuinely one of the best professors Ive had at OSU. His class is super engaging and make you wanna get up at 9am to go to lecture. Exams and quizzes are super straight forward if you attend lecture and do the study guide. Definitley would take another class with him.

Professor Smith shows a passion for his teaching like it's nobody's business. The exams are large and robust; however, he provides every student with the opportunity to bring one cheat sheet. I found that making the cheat sheet itself is a great way to study, to the point where I barely needed to reference it during the exams.

Decent guy but awful lecturer. Spends a ridiculous amount of time on irrelevant, inane details but hurries over the important stuff. Thinks he is more entertaining than he is, essentially no room for discussion because he loves the sound of his own voice. Slides are incredibly disorganized. Extra credit not worth the pain of sitting through class

lectures are long bc he talks a lot but they're interesting and there are not many papers. I took it for honors credit and the only additional requirement was a research paper. hes also veyr fun to talk to and understanding of conflicts or extensions

Genuinely one of the funniest professors I have ever had. He made waking up at 9 AM to go to class easy because he was that great. Content was really interesting. Grade depends on quizzes and 3 exams. Quizzes were easy, exams did take a good amount of studying but they really weren't that bad plus it's possible to not have to take the final.

Charles was amazing. His lectures are engaging, he's funny, and the content is useful for anyone hoping to go to law school or work in the government. The tests took a bit of studying, but none of the exams were overly challenging, and he lets you opt out of the final if you do well enough on the first 2 exams. Can't recommend him enough.
great professor. I took the honors section. Go to class and you'll do great

I took Gun Politics spring of 2023 while I was really struggling with my mental health. I fell extremely behind in this class from not doing any assignments and was failing. I reached out to Prof. Smith and he was so kind and helpful, he was able to meet with me in person that very next day and allowed me to redo EVERY assignment for FULL credit.

I love Professor Smith! He is one of the best professors at Ohio State. I came into this course really hesitant because of his background with gun, but he has made the great for both sides of the argument. He is a really easy grader on papers and gives good feedback. Such a great professor that I am taking his con law class next semester!

Professor Smith is the best political science professor I have had so far at Ohio State. He makes coming to class fun and all of the information that he taught in this class I can recite from memory not from studying just because it was that interesting and not dense to learn. I highly recommend him and this class at least once at Ohio State!
Great professor, great class. He makes it difficult to fail, pay attention to lectures and study a bit. You'll be perfectly fine.

Professor Smith is the best!!! He is one of those professors who will make sure you know the material well while trying not to stress you with exams. I learn so much about the material despite having lots of extra credit!! Just take his class! You wont regret it!!

Really enjoyed Professor Smith, and would take this class again. I took it during the pandemic, so everything was online and open note. If you miss a zoom lecture it was no big deal because he always posted recordings. Quizzes were simple and the midterm and final were online and open note.

This is one of my favorite professors and favorite classes. The material was interesting and he does a really great job of discussing controversial issues. He makes it pretty clear from the beginning he does not want this class to be a point of stress. 2 exams, 4 opinion/reaction essays, 6 quizzes and he drops the lowest. pretty entertaining too!

EASY 4000 level class. Based off of 3 exams and 7 online quizzes. Your lowest quiz score gets converted to extra credit. Exams were very easy, I didn't have to take the final bc my grade was 87+%, and book was "required" but I stopped using it after the first exam because I didn't need it. Ended with 102.5%. Take him! Very funny guy also.

I took two classes with him! He's really funny and makes class enjoyable. It's really hard not to get an A, he gives you so much EC. The shooting range trip was really cool. I also liked the documentaries and guest speakers. Plus he navigates controversial topics really well!

TAKE THIS CLASS! Show up to lecture and you'll ace the quizzes PLUS he'll bump up your grade at the end if he sees you had good attendance. Four short papers and if you turn them in early he'll give you a 100%. Only look at the material he gives you on the review guides and the exams are easy, not to mention there's up to 10pts of EC on the exams.
Annoying and overrated. Take it if you need a GPA boost but not if you wanna learn anything worthwhile
Terribly boring. Charles isn't nearly as interesting or funny as he thinks he is. Information is spread way too thin and honestly the class is pretty useless but it's an easy A.
This guy is terrible. Don't take him, "Me and academia have a weird relationship"

This professor hates it when students know more than he does; he gets jealous and will cut you off if your information is too good. Try taking this class with another professor, he sucks real bad. He writes emails like their essays. Beware of quizzes cause none of his lecture notes cover the quiz.

He's a really weird guy; he will ramble for 30 min straight and then try to teach in the last 15 minutes. His quizzes are straight from the textbook. Nothing from his lecture notes will be on the quiz(use control f for book answers). His final exam was 12 review equations. Try working on the questions a few weeks before the actual exam

Do not take this professor if you want to cry. I took his class this fall, 2024, for a 7-week session; it was the worst experience ever! He rambles for about 30  minutes straight, and then, during the last 15 minutes of class, he wants to start teaching. He sucks at technology and always blames the computer.

Dr. Zilber comes across as super rude during lectures and on his online posts. I have never had a professor so rude in my entire experience at tOSU. The test are also not tests on the course material, but tests on specific examples from the textbook. Try to take this course with another prof or just choose another course.

Terrible. Nothing is learned form lectures, only grades in the class are exams and discussion boards. Online textbook will be able to get you through everything besides the final. In which the average will be a 55% due to his harsh grading. On top of all this, good luck getting through one of his mandatory lectures without falling asleep. AVOID

I think a lot of the reviews here kind of overexaggerate the negatives of Professor Zilber's teaching style. Generally, he has a very clear method to how he grades, attendance(mandatory and random), discussions(remind yourself to keep up with them), and biweekly scheduled quizzes. You can kind of slack off lectures, just remember the big ideas.

Zilber is ok. Your grade is just discussions and quizzes, and one final. He sometimes takes attendance and grades on it, but does it by random. TAKE NOTES, the quizzes are open note so use that to your advantage. He rambles a lot, and is kinda condescending. Wouldn't take him again but he knows his stuff and is a nice guy.
Just read and pay attention and you'll be fine. Use control f. All tests online open note.

I was in his "Political Science: Voters and Elections" course and the class material was not very difficult. The class could've have been a lot less stressful if Zilber did not go on random tangents during lecture, and did not give his own opinion on the subjects being taught.

Very old-fashioned way of teaching, but if you can take notes that keep up with his rambling you'll be fine. Didn't have to read the textbook; just use Ctrl+F on an online textbook to easily find the answers for quizzes. Makes it very clear what he expects of students, so there's little room for error. I barely tried in his class and got an A+.

Terrible professor, the worst professor I have ever had. He hates using technology and notes have to be taken by yourself on whatever he is rambling on about. He hates repeating himself and the structure of the class is just overall confusing.

Very boring, have to take your own notes and if you miss class you have to catch up and read the textbook. Textbook is much more important than in class "notes." He does not use technology that much so it can be hard to adjust to. Overall, very boring class, if you need to take it, read the textbook since class lecturers barely cover content ontest

Professor Zilber was great! The class and the films shown were very interesting. Attendance is mandatory. There ar weekly reading quizzes. DBs require about an hour or two a week to get a perfect score (critically graded). I enjoyed the class but if you are not willing to put in the time outside of class you will not get a good grade.

if you show up to class and listen to his lectures, you will be fine. However, the lectures are very boring. He's not a bad guy, it's just a hard class to sit through. Sometimes he makes occasional funny jokes though

I see only negative reviews here, but I actually came to really like Jeremy by the end of the semester. His lectures are boring, but his dry sense of humor makes them somewhat bearable. His grading is reasonable, but some quiz questions can be difficult. He appears to have a harsh exterior, but he's more understanding and kind than you would think.

ok professor. sometimes the lectures are important and pertain to the subject of the class and other times the whole class doesn't matter. probably learn more reading than in the lectures, but randomly you will have to know stuff from class on quizzes. Easyish grader - pointed out lots of wrong with my homeworks and then still got 100% so idk.

Unprofessional, and even more than that. This man is passive-aggressive and won't give you a clear answer to questions that he should know as the lecturer with a Ph.D. in poli-sci. He assigned a textbook with a heavy slant over academic research. This class is not beneficial in my already busy schedule so I dropped it after 3 lectures. Be aware!

Seems to assume that every student should be making groundbreaking work in the course materials. Also tends to come off as very dismissive and passive aggressive when providing feedback, as if he is too good to do so.

DO NOT ENROLL IN THIS CLASS! I have never had a worse professor in my academic experience. Makes discussion topics due at 11:59 p.m, and if they are posted before the due date, you are screwed even if you submit them before 11:59 p.m. The final was a three-page response to one question, plus two additional pages. Makes weird bald jokes.

Interesting class if you participate. He talks a lot but he's a smart guy and you can learn a lot from him. Dont bother buying the textbook you never use it. Also do the extra credit papers even if you dont think you'll need it, they are free points and very easy. He has some biased takes and again talks a lot but all in all a good professor.
Best professor I have ever had!

You're graded on five assignments. Biggest piece of advice is do the extra credit and submit the SEI because that is how I got an A. I had polite email correspondence with him but I probably would not take his class in person. The content is very straightforward and he sends quality reminder emails. Don't always trust RMP reviews :)
Tough grading and rude communication from the professor make this a challenging class. Luckily, Unstuck ai and the course textbook can help students stay on top of the material.
Guy's a well-paid yappitron. He's like one of those over-confident profs but presents clear anecdotal data like they're pure facts. Entertaining class tho.

Keshk was okay, he didn't do office hours only meet by appointment. Lectures were PDF's so you have to read and teach yourself. Practice the R software. You're only graded on 4 assignments and a final exam, one of the assignments is optional/EC. The math isn't hard, just basic arithmetic. I wouldn't take him again because of his hands-off style.

Does not take attendance, nor is it graded. The class primarily consisted of him talking about the topic for a while and then just rambling until he got tired and then would let the class out early. As far as mandatory assignments there are 2 short papers and one final 4-page paper but then you can do up to 4 short 1-page papers for extra credit.

Although this was an online class I believe it is obvious that Professor Keshk doesn't care to much about the class as the work done to set up the class is minimal and how you take the quizzes and tests is done in a very lazy fashion.

class always ends early. lectures aren't really over anything important to the class, but the subject is super easy to grasp on your own. 2 short papers and one final 4 page paper - really easy to do. class is honestly just him talking about random things until he looses track and calls it for the day. he's funny though so kinda interesting.

Only 3 papers. Class is just him discussing some world issue he thinks is interesting and does not cover actual material. There is no rubric to papers, does not provide insightful feedback but not hard to get a B or A. Lectures are boring, and he tries to be humorous with witty jokes. Class is not mandatory but he takes attendance for points.

Attendance is not mandatory, but you will miss a lesson segment if you don't attend. Only 4 assignments- not hard, but do not except him to be accessible after class. Ends class 20 minutes early always which is a plus, but also tends to get behind. Exam was not hard, all you need is to show up and take notes and you'll be fine. Thinks he's funny...
Took him twice. Very knowledgeable, wry humor. Statistics class is difficult information but provided very plainly. Makes theories make sense.

He's blah, and I wouldn't take his class to learn information. Most lectures just become discussions, and you could get a B pretty easily just not being dumb, but you can also get a B trying/showing up to every lecture, so it's really not worth it. He doesn't give good feedback and his humor is meh, but at leastyou won't fail with minimal effort.

The professor seems like a nice guy, but his method of teaching and grading makes it very hard to pass. The assignments are posted via a quiz, which is put under the strictest settings possible to "avoid cheating," but is hard to understand what part of the assignment it's asking about. Be assertive and tell him when you shouldn't  loose points.
He's a great teacher and knows what he's doing. Bunch of extra credit and not a tough grader. I would definitely take his class again.

Dr. Keshk is one of my favorite professors. He values communication and discussion, and their result is always inspirational. Take this course if you want to have a good start in your academic career in world development.

Talks to a silent class most of the time but people who are actually interested in their majors participate in the discussion. If you enjoy International Studies take this class, you get to have many interesting conversations and as long as you structure your essays right, your grade will be fine.

"Dr." Keshk is rude, thoughtless, and unworthy of the title professor. He allows carmen to grade assignments, and is unwilling to change mistakes carmen made. I went through a grade appeal process because he tried to fail me. According to him, I scored a 52% in his class, but according to the appeal process, I scored a 97%. Don't take his classes.
Actually the worst professor and could care less about the students success
Class material and lectures are presented through PDF. Instructor has limited office hours for assistance.

Really nice professor and explains the content very well. Easy class if you pay attention and practice the stuff. Good intro to R course, hard to get less than an A unless you dont attempt the homeworks. Final project is not bad if you put in a little effort. Very easy grader and super understandable guy.

This professor had a relatively easy semester in which it was easy to learn R Studio, however the final project, worth 20% of your grade, isn't covered well in class and the final rubric doesn't list all the expectations, but if you really bomb it and have been doing well the rest of the semester, you're sure to land a B.
Bad class just cuz I hate coding. Super Amazing guy, wouldn't want it taught by anyone else. Very understanding and chill

Professor Minozzi has a philosophy around grading that is very beneficial to students. His belief is that students should show good faith effort and improvement in their learning and this should be rewarded with an A. The class had a lot more coding than you would expect from a Political Science class but it was nothing super difficult.

Minozzi in my opinion is one of the most underrated professors I have ever had. He was a great lecturer, beginning of course is kind of theory heavy, however, the class was interesting and he always explained things clearly and in a snarky funny way. Would definitely recommend taking his class. Not especially difficult either!!

Minozzi was definitely the best professor I have ever had. He's very quirky and helps you understand the material in a funny way. As long as he sees you're putting forth an effort, you will pass his class. There are a lot of readings so make sure you do them or you will definitely struggle.

The fans understand his stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate him, to realise that he says something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike William truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldnt appreciate, for instance, the humour in William existential catchphrase "it's a feature not a bug."

Really engaging, and in a class that's centered around the President, he makes a concious effort to stay as nonpartisan and unbiased as possible. He is extremely engaging, and present his leftures in a way that makes you think. My favorote class I've taken so far, and one of the most fair classes I've taken. 10/10 would reccomend this professor.
He's really involved and is always willing to help outside of class, he never gives you the answer but gives you the info and tools to figure it out for yourself. Really great guy!

I think this professor gets a bad rep. He is a very tough grader and I struggled on the first exam but was able to recover.  If you seek out the help, he's there for you when you do. AMAZING lecutres, corky and funny. Really engages the students. I lowkey love going to this class. Attendance notmandatory but I highly recommend going. no textbook

like most PA classes, he assigns research papers for each class. He does however have quizzes each class over readings. I personally don't recommend taking this class if you want to gain something w/your PS degree. 4 essay exams, tough grader. He does allow you to use a cheat sheet(1 page).  Go to class, otherwise you will not do well on the exams.
Nice enough guy, kinda smarmy. 70% of grade was 15 page minimum paper.

Prof Minozzi is an interesting teacher. I learn new things through our class discussions and research papers we read. Fair expectations and smart guy. We have four non-cumulative exams and one easy quiz every class just to make sure you read the research papers. He's friendly and approachable in his office hour. Has a nice room too. Commendable.
Prof. Minozzi was very knowledgeable and interesting to listen to. He wasn't at all flexible in dealing with (excused) absences though. Overall a good professor to take a class from.
Smart guy, but very unwilling to help in my opinion. If you attend class and do the readings, you should be alright. But don't expect very helpful responses if you email/ask him questions.

He is really intelligent and makes class interesting.  There was a data project about one of several topics relating to the presidency: mine was about the relationship between the state of the economy and the probability for an incumbent to be re-elected.  It is a really fun project, and you should get an A if you take it seriously.

Smart guy, Stanford degree. Knows his stuff, will do all he can to make sure you know it too. Kinda smug, but deservedly so: he's bright. Word of warning: there are daily assignments, and his TA is a bit of a wack job with a stingy rubric. If you do it, you get at least a C, but for those who'd rather get an A on every assignment, it's frustrating.

Not the easiest class, but he does a great job of communicating the subject matter clearly.  A clear sense of impartiality, which is necessary in discussions of presidential politics.  Maybe the best teacher I've had.

Prof. Minozzi was extremely insightful and helpful.  While the class can be contain lots of reading, he went beyond what most professors would in order to explain it.  His exam was fair.  And he's a heck of a nice guy.

This was a great class. Easy grade if you did the reading, came to class, and followed instructions. And if you do those things you actually learn a lot! What more could you ask for. Some say he picks on students, but its just sarcastic humor and he is actually pretty funny.

Prof Davis was a really responsive instructor. I took this class online so he was really hands-off, but as long as you complete work on time and stay up to date on the Carmen page/announcements, you'll do well.

Professor Davis is a kind professor. Each week, you are assigned a chapter from the textbook, and he provides videos lectures to help you with discussion posts and quizzes. He does a group project instead of any exams. The project was interesting, but difficult for an online class. However, as long as you communicate with him, you will do well.

She reads straight from her paper of notes and jumbles over her words a lot which makes her super confusing because she always contradicts herself. Nice person but not a fan of her teaching style. Also she is a super slow grader. Biggest issue was her just reading her own notes which sometimes did not even relate to the slides.

This class was managable, I recommend going to class the first month or two and then if you feel like you got it it doesn't matter if you stop attending class. This class has lots of papers so just be prepared to write. I didn't go to class the second half of the semester and ended with a 97 you will be fine. But professor Mitzen is awsome.
Her grading criteria were clear and understandable, for her papers I never questioned what I needed to write. You will be fine if you read the lecture notes and attend some major lectures.

Tons of reading but the online material she posts, interaction on Canvas, etc makes the course material easy to digest and navigate. If you read all the essays posted throughout the course, you will find the essay-writing assignments or discussion posts quite easy. Very easy grader too and very easy to approach and get any questions answered.
So nice!!!
Dr Mitzen is an amazing professor. I highly recommend going to her office hours. She really care about us, even though she is a full professor doing research.

Dr. Mitzen is great! I took POLITSC 1300, Global Politics, with her. She has a nice voice and is engaging. She offers Zoom calls for those who cannot attend class in-person, although in-person attendance is expected. She offers extra credit and general she is an easier professor who understands what an intro class should be.

Professor Mitzen is probably one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. She really cares about her students and is great at creating really informative conversations in class. Highly recommend taking a class with her!
Standard upper division IR course except this one comes with frequent reading quizzes that consist of vague questions worth 0.5 pts each for a total of 3/4 pts per quiz.

Professor Mitzen is a really kind Professor and is genuinely passionate about her teachings. I didnt think the homework was too overbearing and the quizzes were pretty easy. Towards the end of the semester some of the classes got a little boring, but the material was presented well.

Professor Mitzen did an excellent job handling the course during the pandemic. It was very easy to learn the material, and her lectures were engaging throughout the semester. This class has a lot of assignments of varied type (essays, quizzes, etc), but no assignment ever felt like it was busywork.

Professor Mitzen is SUCH a genuine and helpful woman. Really knowledgable about global politics and wants to make sure her students don't just do well in the class, but gain a true understanding of the topic. The class had a decent amount of writing assignments, but they were all doable; class takes effort but an A isn't hard to achieve.

Mitzen is a nice person and knowledgable prof but there are just TOO many assignments in this class. Movie responses, papers, short essays, group projects, etc. I feel like with all the stuff she throws at you it's hard to keep your head above water, especially in the midst of a pandemic.

Professor Mitzen is a great professor. Shes obviously very knowledgeable about what she teaches, and shes very kind and understanding. Only complaint is that there are a lot of papers- it seems like theres always something due for this class, especially in the second half.

This is the most boring political science class I have ever taken. Lectures are very boring and she delivers everything as if it's incredibly profound, but it just doesn't make sense. Work level is manageable, papers aren't too bad, and there is a big group project/simulation at the end. Would be bearable if lecture wasn't so boring.

I've never had any professor throw as much work at me in one class. Usually they pick a medium: tests, papers, group projects, movies, quizzes-- No In this class, its all of the above. I am drowning. 6 papers total. have to watch 2 movies. big group simulation. the content is fascinating but i can't keep my head above water with her expectations.

She was alright. She gives you the whole test to review a week before each exam. There's reading quizzes and group work so you kinda need to go to class. My main issue was she didn't use much visual aid; you really need to be a good auditory learner to succeed in class. I liked the movie-viewing hw! She seems pretty passionate about IR.

She did not count any of our exam grades towards our final grade so our final grade literally consisted for two 5 point papers and a 14 point syllabus quiz, so studying for hours for each exam was a WASTE and I ended with a lower grade than I would have had those exams actually COUNTED.. but hey it's good for the people who failed the exams i guess

A great professor, but it's sometimes hard to concentrate because it is all lecture-based and can be boring. Make sure to go to lecture and take notes because there are lecture questions on the exams. Generally gives you what is going to be on tests, which is helpful.

Dr. Mitzen was pretty middle of the road for me. The class was really dry even for someone who loves Political Science, but she's super straightforward about what she wants you to know and what the exams will look like. Don't take this if you aren't interested in PoliSci, but if you are you should find this relatively easy.

He's fine if you work to understand the readings. His lectures are dry and give a false sense of understanding at times. But make sure to take good notes and pay attention in to what he says because that's the best exam prep. Test questions are poorly worded with multiple answers seemingly correct. Final paper was easy and seemed like a grade boost

Overall, Professor Nelson was a good professor. If taking his 3170 course, take good notes during his lectures because for his exams he sometimes refers to specific details barely covered during lecture. Exam questions are also sometimes worded in strange ways with the answers not very clear so beware. Overall, not a bad professor.

Nelson was okay, he wasn't too responsive on email. Sometimes the class discussion portion of the lectures run long and we don't cover all the slides for notes, but the things not covered will still be on the exams. Good guy though.
he hides his intolerance behind jokes

This was probably one of the hardest political science classes I've taken. The readings were really interesting which I appreciated. Overall though, Professor Nelson was fine but his tests were very difficult and he graded the papers harshly as well. He did curve our grades a little though.

Class isnt really interesting and is just way harder than it needs to be, second lowest gpa on the department and spends the whole lecture on one topic going in more depth than he needs to be, attendance is t mandatory but if you dont go there are 0 resources to have a majority of the material explained to you

Professor Nelson seems like an extremely nice guy. I just think the way he teaches isnt effective at all. His lectures seem very simple it feels like you understand the subject but the readings are much tougher. I think he should incorporate more of the reading into lecture. On exams he words things in a confusing way with multiple right answers

I would not recommend taking any course with Thomas. The lecture material is hard to shift through and the lack of explanation makes it impossible to study for test. Youre essentially graded on 4 different things through the course. Ohio State has some amazing lectures and political science classes that will help you grow, this isnt one.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TO. The lectures are so boring, it's hard to attend. The exams are extremely hard. Weekly quizzes that are 3 questions each. 1 final paper. The topic for the paper is extremely vague. The exams are challenging and mostly based off of lecture.

I would NOT recommend taking this class. 3 exams and a paper make up 95% of the grade. Test questions are confusing and the paper instruction is very vague. The worst grade I've ever received, retaking just to save my GPA. Professor seems nice but the class is terrible. Save yourself

Fairly standard lecture-heavy course. Extremely manageable: three exams, all easy if you pay attention in class and go over the study guides that have exactly what you need to know on them. One short paper that's opinion based. A bit dry sometimes but honestly I wish I could have him for every class, he's a very manageable, respectable teacher.

The class lectures leaned toward monotone and dry. It was unfortunate, because I think that Prof. Nelson is really passionate about the subject. He seems like a brilliant social scientist, but his lectures were unfortunately not very engaging. It was also made more difficult by the fact that the exam content and paper criteria were not very clear.

My first ever B earned in this class. He never responds to emails. He is extremely boring, didn't learn a thing in this class. Would not recommend taking any classes and especially not political psychology. The exams were really hard. Only 36 multiple choice questions that are extremely confusing. Weekly reading quizzes that can tank your grade.

I really liked this class. It was low-effort but topical/useful/informative. There are textbook quizzes on Carmen, but they aren't worth much and the exams were based entirely on lecture. Lecture kind of drones on, but he posts the slides online and the exams were cake.
If you're interested in his subject area, his class isn't too bad. But he's a fairly dry lecturer, and is a bit monotonous.
Great professor - a bit dry and hard to pay attention to. Very personable and willing to help if students need help. Excellent professor.
Pretty much the same as what other folks have said, he's not super inspiring, but his class is pretty easy and one of the best ways to get rid of the elective for the BS in PoliSci

To be frank, very boring course/professor. Lectures are dry/confusing and the whole course just falls flat consistently. The tests pretty much boil down to terminology which I find rather uninspiring but reasonably easy to study, so there's that at least. End of the day I feel I've barely learned anything from it and  that's a real shame.
Class is so so boring. Taught myself a lot of the time because it was so hard to go. The tests are a little tricky, but if you go to class and pay attention you can probably get an A.

He can be a bit dry, ok really dry. However he grades on a curve set from the bottom instead of the top which is nice. We hardly use the textbook and he uses a lot of examples. Take his pretests, most of the questions are on the exam.
Tophat participation and attendance graded. Only other grader are two exams and a paper.

Incredibly smart and educated professor. Great class. Lots of information in a short amount of time. Very quiet speaker but values opinions and discussion. Not an easy A but you will get a lot out of this class if you put the effort in.

One of the smartest / best professors I have had at OSU. This class will stretch your mind and you will grow as a student. Very discussion based. However, this is not an easy class. Does not round grade. You will have to put in a lot of work. You will be able to use what you learn in her class in other classes. Highly recommended

She is so engaging and wants everyone to do well in class. She is big on participation during discussions but if you talk to her she will include you in the discussions. Easily accessible outside of class. Her class is not an easy A, but probably one of the smartest professors in the Political Science department. Can not recommend her enough!

Dr.Saunders-Hastings is a phenomenal instructor and keeps the class engaged. She provides clear instructions and keeps everything organized. She provides excellent feedback on papers and she gives great advice about research.

Amazing professor, challenging but wildly interesting & enjoyable course. Dr. Saunders-Hastings was very supportive, always accessible outside of class, seems genuinely invested in students' growth. I never felt overlooked even as an undergrad in a graduate course. One of my favorite classes/profs to date!

This was one of my favorite classes. Professor Saunders-Hastings is so smart and our readings and lectures were always very engaging and interesting. It was not too hard either as long as you show up, engage and do the readings. I really enjoyed this class and got a lot out of it.

An absolute queen. She is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. The class can be hard, but it's doable as long as you stay on top of the readings and show up every day. She encourages you to explore your own ideas in papers and she is one of the smartest people I've ever met. Really knows the ins and outs of political theory. Overall 10/10

She is so nice and helpful. If you have any suggestions, she is always willing to listen and is always looking to improve your learning experience. Definitely do the reading though and definitely participate. She was never judgmental of the ideas you have and always willing to explore them in more depth. Overall I really like her as a professor.

Very difficult but rewarding class. Took this for my minor and it was one of my favorites of the semester. I think it's a testament to a professor about how they handled the COVID-19 situation and ESH made the transition smooth and was very understanding. She is obviously very intelligent but is a tough grader, and the class has a LOT of reading.

This course is very objective, it is almost all based on philosophy. If you don't have an original idea or agree with prof. you may receive a bad grade on papers on tests. She grades off how much effort she thinks you gave. Also, she will tear you apart in your papers even though there are no clear-cut guidelines on what she really wants.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings definitely knows what shes doing; shes clearly knowledgeable on analyzing political arguments. 3440 was extremely reading intensive, but the readings were all valuable and had a clear purpose in the course. Shes super approachable; 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings is extremely knowledgeable on many topics and conceptualizes political theory like none other. The class however, is extremely reading-intensive, and it can be very easy to fall behind in the difficulty and the amount of readings given. Dont take her class if youre looking for an easy grade-booster, youll get the opposite.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings is outstanding. Her class is demanding, but it was the most intellectually engaging class I've taken in college. She is wicked smart, accessible outside of class, and is really caring and gives positive feedback. She is overall incredible and so good at guiding class discussion and analyzing the nuances of political theories.

Do not take this class if you want your grade to be determined by 4 things. 2 of the grades in this class are done by the TA and the other 2 are a midterm and a final. There is no and I mean NO wiggle room if you do poorly on one assignment. All the "answers" in this class are subjective which should lean towards leniency but there is none.

I absolutely loved having Prof. Saunders-Hastings! Shes incredibly intelligent, and she very much knows her way around political theory. Some of the readings were dense, but she was very understanding and approachable about them, and it was quite apparent how thoughtfully she put together the syllabus. I would die for her, honestly. Amazing prof.

Prof Saunders-Hastings is so smart and knowledgable. I learned sooo much from this class and it was super interesting. It's not the easiest class but if you put in a decent amount of effort there's no reason you shouldn't succeed.

VERY EASY. There's two grades for the whole class: midterm and final. They are both in-person writing, but he gives you the prompts a WEEK in advance. He told us on the first day if you show up you will get an A and that is definitely true.

Professor Schweller is unlike any other professor I've had before, but not in a bad way. He is brutally honest and relatively apolitical. His exams are incredibly easy and he lets you know that you don't really have to do the readings. Lectures are not mandatory but I go because he is such an interesting person and provides some hot takes.

I specifically took this class to challenge my perspectives in IR. My major issue was the professor's assumptions about IR were presented in a take it or leave it manner, which in my view is not a great way to argue. He does not challenge you on the exam (basically rote memorization). I would take this class as a GPA boost.

Dr. Schweller is one of the few professors where I go to his class not because I need to know the information but because I actually am interested and want to know what he has to say about things. I very much wish he wasn't so conservative, because I'm not. But, the class is easy and there's a lot to learn from his lectures on realism especially.

Really great professor, lectures are engaging, he's not out to batter your GPA. He's apolitical and non-ideological in his lectures, he's not the typical prof that desperately attempts to force social narratives under the guise of education. He won't waste your time, if the lecture finishes early, you're a free man. Genuinely interesting, as well.

Schweller has been my favorite professor so far. You don't need to worry about grades in his class and his lectures are super interesting and he has great TA's. He makes a lot of very complex ideas brief and understandable. Only worry is if you cannot stand someone who is right wing, Schweller very much seems to be.

His lectures are okay. There can be really interesting content, but sometimes he just goes on unrelated rants. He says he's a realist every time he gets a chance and says some really out of pocket stuff sometimes but in a funny way. Class is super easy though, I would take it if you need a GPA boost.

Apparently Schweller is famous in the IR field and a fine teacher who explains different IR theories well. Easy class - never showed up in person, watched a few recordings, grinded on the paper before ddl, and got 100% on both midterm and final.
Never showed up and got an A. Didn't learn anything.

Dr Schweller is one of the most interesting teachers I have had at OSU. All of his lectures are interesting, and they are extremely helpful to expanding the way you think critically about international politics. Even his inane ramblings are interesting. The readings are very well chosen. Cannot recommend this Professor enough

Professor Schweller had some interesting lectures, but would also go on random rants about weird stuff (he's very pro-Trump, and has a tendency to talk over people even if they agree with him). The course itself is not hard at all - a couple of big exams that are very hard to do badly on.

Class is graded by two tests and nothing else. He posts all of the lecture notes and powerpoints online. Also posts the midterm and final so you know exactly what will be on them. Will constantly tell you he's a realist. Amazing course to take during the pandemic. You won't regret it.

Professor Schweller is super opinionated. His lectures are extremely boring but not necessary as long as you understand the general concepts/theories from the powerpoints. The only grades are a midterm and final, and both are essays (he's not a hard grader). Overall, an easy class, but my least favorite professor ever.

Professor Schweller is awesome! He doesn't want to tank your GPA or make your life difficult for no reason. The entire class is graded by your midterm and final. He gives you plenty of resources on Carmen (including past tests ;) ) I 100% recommend taking this class.

Prof. Schwellers class was very, very easy. Our final exam was completely opinion-based, and we didnt have to cite any of the class material for the essay. He doesnt care about killing your GPA and making your life miserable for a semester  he really just wants you to learn, and thats your choice if you do or not. Hes a nice guy!

Professor Schweller is an amazing professor! Hes really laid back and doesnt try to make your life miserable! Hes very precise with the exam questions and if you pay attention in class youll pull through with an A. Class is all exams and little to no extra credit.

The only way to not get an A is if you literally don't try *at all*. Exam questions are given beforehand. However because of this the class was honestly kind of boring and not worth going to. He's nice but doesn't really care about undergrads but that's not all that unfamiliar in the poli sci department.

This class is dumb easy. Only grades are the midterm and final, but he gives you the questions beforehand and only makes you write a response for 1 or 2 of them. He also gives you the answers to all the questions the lecture before both exams. Dr Schweller is very knowledgeable and decently funny, so lectures arent bad either

Incredibly easy A, but it's a bit boring because of that. Reading isn't required, there's no homework, and there is one midterm and one final, which he grades pretty easily. If you're looking for an easy A this is the class, but if you want something more intellectually stimulating I would find another class.

Wonderful professor, very caring towards students, and offered to meet students over coffee rather than sit in an office. Wants to see everyone do well, and get an A. Will only be graded for midterm and final, but as long as you attend class, read your notes routinely, and ask questions, you will get an A.

Really easy A. Literally show up to class and study a bit for the two exams and you'll get an A. That being sad, he's a really intelligent man with unique ideas, and he loves hearing from his students. If you go to class, you'll learn quite a bit.

A midterm and a final, each worth 50% of your grade. Gives you the essay questions ahead of time, so if you prepare even a little bit for the exams you'll definitely pass if not get an A. In my class over 70% got As on the midterm.

Class lectures can be very dry if you're not into Polisci. He is very laid back and it shows in the class. There are only two grades in the class. A midterm and final. Both are essays that he gives you ahead of time and grades them with a ton of leniency. He is a realist and not afraid to share his opinion
interesting, relatively easy class
He's a good, easy going professor but in case you couldn't tell he reminds you daily that he is a realist

Dr. Schweller is a great professor. This class isn't hard because he makes it clear that he's not trying to make your life hard for no reason. He wants people to get A's and learn. Class always gets out early and he is always available to talk.

Dr. Schweller is really incredible. He is one of the most influential political scientist of today and his contribution to the field is amazing. Class usually lets out early and only graded on two things. He's sarcastic, and it's hilarious. To counter some other comments, he is highly attractive, as well as highly intriguing to chat with.

Took this class for my minor and it was so easy. Schweller isn't out to make your life hard and posts all lecture slides online. Tells you not to do the reading, only has two midterms for the whole grade which he gives you the essay questions in advance and you pick the ones you want to answer. I went on review and exam days only and did just fine.

This man is a solid academic in this field, so he is very knowledgable on the issues he teaches. This class is simple as grading is comprised of a midterm and a final exam, that's all. Exams are also just 1 essay question. He can be hilariously sarcastic at times and he is very clear about his political viewpoints. Just come in with an open mind.
Awesome professor. Super easy class.

Dr. Schweller connected well with our class and made it clear that he was there to help and teach, not to give us a hard time. A midterm (2 essay questions) and a final (1 essay question) determine the entirety of your grade, but he gives the questions out in advance. Pay attention and attend lectures and you'll get an A.
He is a great guy who gives clear lectures and has clear expectations for the class. Great guy with an easy A class. I would take anything with him.

He is the most interesting professor. He gives 2 exams and that's it. He posted all of the notes online. He is super willing to make time for his students. Take his classes if you can! He is really smart and knows his stuff.

He is among the top in his field, lectures are short and concise, exams are a breeze. He is sarcastic, if you understand his humor, hilarious. I have never asked for help as I haven't needed any thus far, but I have talked to him and he is genuine and ready to help. I highly suggest his courses, but show up and take notes , don't have to read!

Definitely one of my favorite professors that I have had here. He is certainly a bit arrogant when it comes to his knowledge on the subjects he teaches (he is a renowned political scientist with a few successful published books), but can you blame the guy? Super cool professor, really just cares that you're learning something. Relatively easy class

Great GPA booster. Creates a great dynamic of very interesting lectures (that usually end early) + really easily graded exams (that he gives you the questions for beforehand). You could probably skip all the lectures and still get an A if you know some stuff about diplomacy and watch his youtube videos.

Didn't really go to his lectures - class was supposed to be an hour twenty but he could barely lecture for 40 min and we'd be out. If you know about political science or have already taken a class this class will be easy. No need to purchase the textbooks either, its midtermfinal type of class all essays not hard at all.

Schweller is the man. A midterm and a final. Each is worth 50%. He condenses the reading and presents the major points in lecture. You don't need to read one assignment to pass. Just come to lecture and take good notes. Studied around 10 hours for each exam and did well. He's very entertaining and a leading thinker in his field. Don't miss out.

Professor Schweller is one of the best professors in an amazing PoliSci department. He gets where we're coming from and isn't trying to screw us on grading. As an added bonus, he travels a lot and many Friday classes are cancelled.

Schweller is the best professor i've had at OSU. Hes a genius & amazing professor. His lectures are extremely informative and interesting. Exams arent too tough as long as you prepare, theyre inclass essays, but he lets you know before what the questions are & how to prepare for them. Meets outside of class or stays after to talk. very relaxed guy

Lectures are interesting and you get out early everyday. He is a cool guy and explains the midterm and final the class before the exam. Readings aren't necessary as long as you attend lectures and take good notes. The work load is light but you still learn a lot.
Absolutely love Schweller! Take a seminar with him, you won't be disappointed.

The dude is a leading researcher in global politics, name drops the Grateful Dead like it's nothing, and gives you his (easily graded) exams ahead of time. No trying to trick you, straightforward and interesting lectures. Highly recommend taking his Security & Strategies of War class also.

One of my favorite professors at OSU! His lectures are pretty thorough and doesn't require that you do the readings. There is a midterm and a final and prepares you for the questions in advance. I would recommend taking him!

The only grades were from the midterm/final and all of the material is just from what he talks about in lectures. Attendance isn't required but the alternative is buying and reading the expensive and dry theory books. Good professor, easy class.

While at the top of his field, Prof. Schweller is also at the top of the teaching pyramid. While many professors may hold one's interest he not only holds it but doesn't give useless busy work. He teaches the subject and leaves the nonsensical busy-work for other professors. The class gave him a standing ovation on the final day; he was great.

Schweller is a sick teacher. He's not gonna baby you but his TA's grade easily and his tests aren't even seemingly difficult. You don't need to read a single thing, just attend lectures and take good notes. The tests are based entirely on the lectures. Nice guy and will respond quickly and satisfyingly to emails. Take this class with him.

Great professor.  No need to read the book, just show up and take good notes.  Presents interesting and concise material.  No unnecessary work--just a midterm and final.  You get out early everyday.  At the last class he actually got a round of applause from a 180 student class.  I highly recommend.

Great guy, makes class funny and worthwhile. Reading isn't really mandatory as long as you go to class to get all the information. The only grades are 2 midterm essays and 2 final essays. He's really laid back in class, but a brilliant guy who loves teaching his subject. I would def recommend this class to anyone!
Overall great professor. No unnecessary work, and the lectures are clear and concise. He's lots of help outside of class if you ask, and he's extremely intelligent and funny. Quite charming.

One of the only classes in the IS major that I actually learned something from and applied to future classes. Had him last year and wished he taught more classes. He doesn't use ppt's or carmen often, therefore going to class would be beneficial to do well (which is easy b/c you can write word for word on your test what he said in class) =].

Really good professor. Doesn't use power point because he feels students should actually listen rather than read what he's saying. Lectures are short and concise. Exams are extremely straight forward, and he'll practically tell you what the questions are during his review session. Very good professor, highly recommend.

First, he is not attractive. Second, he does not really care too much and does not grade the work. He is Republican, though. I thought the TA graded kind of harshly. 2 testt, both you pick 2 out of 4 in-class essay and write. A lot. No carmen, powerpoints, nothing. I was dissapointed

Class isn't mandatory, but there are no slides and you're not required to do the reading, so you better go if you want to learn anything. Great professor, really knows his stuff and doesn't make anything too complicated. Tests were long essays but actually really easy if you pay attention and study.

Very intelligent professor with lots of knowledge on international security & causes of war.  Organized class.  Reading is completely unnecessary, and he tells you that on the first day of class.  Just attend class, take decent notes, and study (just a little) for the midterm and final.  Funny and enjoyable as well.  Classes always get out early.
Interesting and compelling lecture. Gave only two grades... a midterm and a final.  Quite knowledgeable.  Take him if you get the chance.
Great class. Only a midterm and final and if you go to the class and take good notes there is no reason you shouldn't get an A. Responded quickly to emails.  Very knowledgeable.
Loved this class. Lectures are entertaining and interesting, it's obvious he's incredibly more intelligent than the assigned material. Exams were easy and he had review classes for each.

Very easy professor, not as challenging of a class as a 500 level should be but if your major is poli-sci and you want an easy A take his class.  He doesn't grade the exams either, his TAs do but they are definitely under instruction to grade easy.

Very easy class, as in very difficult to not get an A if you attend most lectures. Readings not necessary, but they are interesting. I can't say I was challenged in this class though, which is disappointing if you have a true interest in International Relations.

his classes are discussion-based, so unless you like being drilled on your knowledge, you'll love the course. no midterm, no final, just a single paper which he grades kindly -- he says he won't give below a B if you really try. schweller is very balanced politically, which can make for some good convos. i had fun and would def recommend him.
Take this class with him, he's fun, he gets you out early, and if you don't miss a class, you'll get at least B.
Very easy class as long as you attend lecture and do the readings. He has a thorough knowledge of the material and explains it very well. Entertaining at times but hard to reach outside of class.
He's very interesting.
He is a very laid back guy, and makes class enjoyable.

He's an intersting lecturer.  I enjoyed the lectures I attended.  The midterm and final were for the most part pretty easy, as long as you've paid attention and done the reading.  I'd recommend taking any class he teaches.
Easy class, good lectures.
He is EASY!!!! Take his class if you can get in it, he does have a P.H.D. from Columbia.

Take the class, he is easy if you like theoretical stuff, but not the most accessible guy.  As for him being a Republican, I think he falls more into the libertarian category on domestic issues, but his neo-realist ideas make him prone to liking the Bush Admin.  He was against the Iraq war, but now is supportive of it, from what I understand.

Great class, Schweller is a huge Realist and a even a Republican (although he said he thought the Iraq war was insane) which is rare among profs I admit (and I am a dem).  Great lectures and you get out like 45 min early each time!  Although christ there were some annoying people in the class I had who asked dumb questions!
Kinda snotty and full of himself, not a hard class but he's not really into teaching and doesnt care about undergrads

Excellent professor, great overview of large ideas.  How can anyone think he is hot?  I veto that.  He has no time for his students, this is his one major drawback, he does not make himself available during office hours, etc.  lectures are fun, but dont try to talk to him, he wont give you the time of day.
excellent professor! Even though i wasnt into the material, he made it interesting.  Easy class to get an a or b...recommend to anyone.
GREAT teacher,INTERESTING if you like theoretical stuff. I second the motion on him being unavilable. Nice guy, unavailable overall. A bit stubborn to concede any points to his students.
Easy teacher. Go to Class and you will get a B.

I didn't think he was so cool- when you'd go in during office hours to ask questions, he was either never there or when he was he'd never talk to you- when I was asking him stuff he actually started a conversation with one of his grad students- incredibly rude
Always lets out class early. Class was a good summary of readings but a little boring at times. It's easy to get an A- or B+ in this class but hard to get an A or anything below a B.
Readings are pretty tough. Explains material very well, but is sometimes contradictory. Funny, and doesn't bore you by using the class time. Exams are relatively easy.
Great professor; I took 550 a couple years ago and there were some incredibly stupid people in there, but Schweller didn't dumb down the class
He is a great teacher and knows his stuff.  He's really entertaining and I actually enjoy going to class.  I wish I had a chance to take more of his classes.
Swell guy, great teacher, lots of fun, learned a ton!  Must take anything taught by Schweller- he's awesome.
550 was awesome.
No Comments
Whoever said he's snotty is an ass.  Randy Schweller is great.  Very good prof, very fair, and very entertaining.
A good bit snotty.

Easy. We talked a lot about how to write, and the rest of the time was devoted to listening to him talk about international politics, with discussion. I always enjoyed class, because he's really funny, and I'm glad I picked this second writing course.
very little work but doesn't give out A's either.  Most of class is listening to him talk out his opinions.  at first interesting, then boring.
The Best, never missed a class
He is one of the best international theory professors I have ever had.  Awesome lectures, hilarious, and fun to actually go to class.
No Comments
No Comments
One of the OSU's top profs! Knows everything about international politics.
funny, smart as hell, good lectures

Professor Thompson is great. You can tell he loves this stuff. I found the tests to be pretty easy, especially considering that they are open-book. He tries his best to make some of the more bland lecture material entertaining and my god does this man love selfies.

Even though the class isn't assignment-heavy, the tests are pretty brutal. The exams are taken online. I wish we had more time to get them done. This isn't an easy A, btw. If you're looking for that, don't take the class.

Great guy, very knowledgeable & approachable. Lectures r interesting. Provides lecture outlines, but exams will be hard if u don't go to class & take notes. Grade is determined by 3 exams & 1 paper. Paper is easy. Content on exams is easy, MC and ID terms/SA, but very time constrained. Do the readings bc u need to cite them on the exam. Fair class
Dr.Thompson is humble instructor and an approachable instructor. He explains everything clearly and makes class entertaining. He is happy to answer questions and give clear feedback.

Professor Thompson knows a lot about what he teaches and is genuinely interested in it, which makes him an excellent teacher. Talk with him when you get the chance, he's friendly and can be very helpful. Show up and take good notes on the slides and you'll do fine.

Dr. Thompson was an excellent instructor. The material was interesting, and he let us apply it to real life. The work was reasonable but make sure that you do well on his midterm and final exams as there are not too many grades in the course. The professor is also very friendly and approachable, so don't be scared to contact or visit him during off

3 exams and a paper, each worth 25%. You have to know your stuff for the exams because he only gives you 50min for 30 multiple choice and 2 short answer questions . You can tell he really enjoys teaching. This makes his lectures entertaining. However, he was prone to getting off topic by answering questions. Lastly, the readings were long and dull.

I recommend this teacher for everyone to take. He is very nice and is easy to talk to. However, you're not graded on too many things so you have to do well on the exams, but overall not that hard of a class to pass and get a good grade in.

Professor Thompson was great this semester. His lectures are PowerPoint led and he explains the main points in the lecture. Study powerpoints for tests and youll pass easily.. attendance isnt mandatory but he does discuss some things on test in class

Super funny and knowledgable guy. Took him for UN Systems 4331 and Environmental Politics 4335 and they were both very informative. I didn't always read the textbook, but he does have some of that material built into his exams. Helpful powerpoints though, so if you study those you'll do fine. You have to attend to understand them though!

Three exams and a paper. No final, and the exams aren't cumulative. Also if you do well on half the exams and the paper, he will probably curve your grade. Mine was curved from a B+ to an A-. Also offers extra credit on your final grade.

Prof. Thompson is great, funny & approacable. There are 3 noncumulative exams and a paper. Exams are MC & then 3 ID terms you write about in detail. Readings show up on the exam but you only need to know the main arguments made in each! DO take if you have an IR focus. Only wish there were study guides for the exams. Other than that I learned alot!

He is very laid back and does not make the class a heavy burden. If you go to class you should do well. Class can get boring often, which is why people skip. Textbook readings are unnecessary but outside readings appear on tests. Three exams (non-cumulative) and a paper. Exams are MC and short answer and mostly straightforward right off his slides

Requires decent effort to do well in the class. Weekly quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 non-cumulative final, 1 term paper, extra credit on research survey & weekly discussion. However, the class is enjoyable, and if you can relate the class materials to what's on the news and media, you will do well. Plus, hompson is caring and helpful at times.

The class was fairly easy, though I already had some background knowledge. He posts his lectures from the previous year online so you can skip class and not miss much. Only worth going to class for current events, which do show up on exams. 3 exams and a paper, but no study guides for the exams. Questions can be kind of specific.

Very knowledgable professor, he knows the content well. No way to do well in the class without doing the reading and the lecture. The quizzes can be tough, and the Exams are not easy either. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities because there is no curve, I was a decimal away from an A and couldn't get it. Not bad class, requires effort.

Quizzes are  difficult,  require you to watch the lectures AND do the reading. Lectures are incredibly dry. Not really willing to help , all the questions need to be sent to the TA and you need to visit their office hours. Asked at the end of the semester if I could have 0.5% bump because that would allow me to apply for major, got a no.
worse professor ever. never answered my emails when i had questions and put everything off to the TA. everything is timed and now very much time to do it either.

One word: awesome. Prof. Thompson is absolutely hilarious and always presents his lectures very clearly. Readings are not necessary since literally all of the test questions are based off of his lectures/slides. However, grades are based on 3 tests and paper, so don't mess up any of them. Overall, a cool guy with info-packed contents.
Hard to focus because he was so attractive. Don't have to do the readings, but look at the abstracts of each one the night before the exam.
Class was useful to attend but not necessary There are a few papers here and there, but mostly the exams are what matters and those are clear cut (exactly what he says in class/ whats on the slides)
Pretty straight-forward class. If you go to lecture and read, you will earn an A. Lectures are fairly interesting and he is a nice guy.

Lectures can be boring (especially early in the semester) but the tests are very straightforward and the slides are on Carmen. If you just take some notes in class and memorize the slides, an A is pretty easy.  Readings aren't necessary as long as you know the authors main points.

Professor Thompson is the man. Loved taking his UN Systems class. Well worth it, especially if you're in International specialization. Only 3 exams and a paper throughout the class, and none are too tough. Put a little time in and you'll do great.
Clear, straightforward, and thorough. Test questions can be somewhat obscure and more focused on names than content, is my only criticism. Good sense of humor.
Thompson is a great professor. Very knowledgeable. Three exams and one final paper plus extra credit opportunities. Take a class with him if you can!

The course is very straightforward, if you go to all the lectures he goes over everything that will be on the exams. The reading is minimal and he stresses the major points in class. He also makes it very interesting.

Love Dr. Thompson. He makes his class super interesting and does current events so you can see how things you are learning affect the real world. Super funny guy, and you can get by without doing the readings. Also he posts his slides online which is awesome for studying.

I'm obsessed with Dr. Thompson! He is THE BEST professor at OSU without a doubt! So funny, doesn't take class too seriously, but also knows the UN and foreign policy like the back of his hand. LOVE HIM! If you can take a class with him, DO IT

Thompson is one the nicest professors I have ever had. His tests are incredibly easy - only 30 multiple choice questions per exam. 3 exams total and 1 paper. The class has a tendency to be boring, but he makes the UN as interesting as possible.
Hands down the BEST professor at Ohio State! He clearly knows a lot about the subject and he is hilarious!  Very easy to talk to and get to know! I highly recommend taking a class with him!!!!
Great instructor. He loves this field and works hard to make sure you enjoy it too. If you have a chance, take his class.

Online version of this class is not difficult.  A quiz every week, midterm, non-comprehensive final, short paper.  I never watched his lectures and only skimmed the readings and came out with an A in the class.  Open book/open note exams & quizzes makes this class easy. (Again, the online version of the class.)
A lot of readings every week, topic got a little dry.

Professor Thompson was a phenomenal instructor! He was organized and presented the material in a clear, interesting way. He doesn't take attendance but did cover current events once a week in class that were included on the midterm and final. He is a fair grader and allows some leeway if needed if you show improvement. I highly recommend his class.

Politics of Global Problems is truly an intro to International Relations, and that is the way Thompson teaches it.  He's quite funny, easy to understand.  Easy class if you do the readings and attend lecture.
He is a really nice guy.
Good teacher.  Interesting.
The Politics of Global Problems. Not too bad of a class if you do the readings and know them well. Attending class is recommended and will clear up difficult material.

He has trouble keeping his political ideas out of these lectures.  A diehard liberal and can't keep his opinions to himself.  Other than that, pretty good, lots of student participation, kinda repeats himself though.

his final is cumulative but gives NO study guides. at all. agree w/below statement re: asking obscure questions on tests, it's very strange. i don't know if his expectations of his students are realistic.

Very boring lectures. Somehow wants papers no more than 3 pages, but 5 sources. Quizzes are easy, but he has a few obscure questions which seem like they are there for you to miss. Seems to pride himself on trying to make the class so you can't get an A. Believe me, he'll tell you.

alex is pretty cool. i'm not a morning person so i had a hard time staying awake, wasn't nec his fault. i learned some but kinda felt like review from peace studies 201. tests okay, papers short. he'll work with you if you get sick -but get doctor's note. good sense of humor, let's ppl debate.
Rambles alot.  Plays favorites.
I was in the aforementioned class and I never saw any dogs...  Anyway, I loved the class and got a lot out of it.  Smart guy and a great class.  Very timely material.
strange guy..loves dogs and brings them to class;obviously hates to teach undergraduates and thinks its beneath him.
he not soooo hot but he's not bad

She reads straight from her paper of notes and jumbles over her words a lot which makes her super confusing because she always contradicts herself. Nice person but not a fan of her teaching style. Also she is a super slow grader. Biggest issue was her just reading her own notes which sometimes did not even relate to the slides.

This class was managable, I recommend going to class the first month or two and then if you feel like you got it it doesn't matter if you stop attending class. This class has lots of papers so just be prepared to write. I didn't go to class the second half of the semester and ended with a 97 you will be fine. But professor Mitzen is awsome.
Her grading criteria were clear and understandable, for her papers I never questioned what I needed to write. You will be fine if you read the lecture notes and attend some major lectures.

Tons of reading but the online material she posts, interaction on Canvas, etc makes the course material easy to digest and navigate. If you read all the essays posted throughout the course, you will find the essay-writing assignments or discussion posts quite easy. Very easy grader too and very easy to approach and get any questions answered.
So nice!!!
Dr Mitzen is an amazing professor. I highly recommend going to her office hours. She really care about us, even though she is a full professor doing research.

Dr. Mitzen is great! I took POLITSC 1300, Global Politics, with her. She has a nice voice and is engaging. She offers Zoom calls for those who cannot attend class in-person, although in-person attendance is expected. She offers extra credit and general she is an easier professor who understands what an intro class should be.

Professor Mitzen is probably one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. She really cares about her students and is great at creating really informative conversations in class. Highly recommend taking a class with her!
Standard upper division IR course except this one comes with frequent reading quizzes that consist of vague questions worth 0.5 pts each for a total of 3/4 pts per quiz.

Professor Mitzen is a really kind Professor and is genuinely passionate about her teachings. I didnt think the homework was too overbearing and the quizzes were pretty easy. Towards the end of the semester some of the classes got a little boring, but the material was presented well.

Professor Mitzen did an excellent job handling the course during the pandemic. It was very easy to learn the material, and her lectures were engaging throughout the semester.
