His tests are extremely hard and his quizzes are on the dumbest little details that we talked about for ten seconds. Do NOT take this class.(I have a 3.9 gpa and will prob get a 2.5 in here)

Took PLS 334 with him and MSU and he was the worst lecturer and the exams were ridiculously hard, and not curved. Class average on midterm was a 70% and he told everyone that he graded very harshly. I went to every class and did all the reading and the midterms were still insanely hard
Easy A if u go to class. Took his class at Michigan State. PLS 394

Literally the most annoying voice i have ever heard. Reads the papers but doesnt really understand them, tells you, you did put things into the paper when they are obviously there. 10/10 would not recommend

I actually took ISS328 online through Michigan State.  Professor Smidt was very helpful BUT his TA took forever to get grades back to you. I learned a lot from this class but I think I could've learned more and done better had I had feedback on my responses and mini-projects earlier than 2 weeks later. Great class!

this guy is boring and does not explain things very good at all. Also, his class is a note taking marathon. If you like to have 50 pages of notes to study for a test Corky is your guy. I don't know what they person is talking about saying he was an easy A? Maybe if you were related to him it was but if not. Take Stat 135 with Sprangers. Avoid Corky

This class was the easiest A but you have to do the work. As long as you have the notebook, do all of your homework, you will definitely be fine. The final was a piece of cake, all it was was memorization of key words and doing problems on the computer.  And he also explains everything and gives detailed examples. Really helpful teacher.
avoid him and his class at all costs!
This guy was not very nice and had enormous power point presentations with many, many, slides. His hw's were very hard and his midterm and final were brutal. Take stat 135 or Ivanchenkos.
*****NOTICE****RMP HAS PLACED THIS TEACHER ON RESTRICTION, SO YOU MUST BE LOGGED IN TO RATE THIS IS DUE TO POSSIBLE ABUSE OF THESE PAGES. Signed RMP Trusted Administrator

Very friendly, funny, and helpful. Unless you're interested in political analysis, you will be bored but that cannot be helped. BTW, you DON'T have to take tons of notes, and he definately does not suck!

One of my favorite OSU professors, and I never even met the guy. His lectures are clear and right to the point. He is extremely accessible outside of class. So as long as you make an effort, and get started on the projects and assignments early in the week (some of them can take a while), you will do well. Useful material to learn, too.

The class was a lot of work, there were weekly group projects and they take hours. He does provide resources to help but they still take forever. Go to all the recitations, he gives extra credit during them and they are very helpful for understanding R. The lectures aren't worth it, they are by a different professor. The final project was ok.

There was a new assignment each week and the assignments did take A LOT of time to do. I spent around 8-9 hours on some of them. There are a lot of extra credit opportunities which got me to end the class with above a 100. You don't really need to watch the lecture videos, just attend recitiation and he'll walk you through what you need to do.

This was probably the hardest class of my semester but at the same time my favorite. The class is genuinely so rewarding to get good at and understand. I hated it at the start but once I got the hang of the coding language I felt so good about myself. Professor Dawe is also extremely helpful so just ask him! One of the best classes I've taken!

Probably the most relaxed "coding" class there is. Assignments can be tricky sometimes, but he is extremely accessible through email/office hours. R is tricky but if you follow the directions step by step and actually attend recitation, it shouldn't be too difficult. The people who complain are the ones who don't go to class. Lots of extra credit!!

Projects assigned as final and as homework can vary in difficulty. Sometimes they can take hours while other times they can take 20 minutes. Prof. Dawe however is very accessible outside of class and will respond to emails to help you quickly. You also have the power of google and stackoverflow to help you. This is a programming class in R language

Professor Dawe is great. Extremely fair and accommodating, very easy to reach and willing to answer many questions. Walks you through every assignment step by step, and makes data analysis and R very easy and interesting. Also, the skills learned are very applicable to the data analytics major, so if you're PPE and DA, take this, no question.

Where do I even begin? Professor Dawe is awesome. Flexible, down to earth, extremely informative. I had no experience or interest in Data Analysis but his recitation/projects made it accessible and interesting. He's super understanding about extensions. You can tell he genuinely cares about seeing his students succeed. Great class!

Does a good job making it easy to learn R. Accessible and willing to help, a very fair grader, and the live recitations are so much more helpful than the lectures in most cases for the actual assignments (the lessons pre recorded by someone else). Sometimes the assignments can take a while and are not always easy but overall an interesting class.

All assignments can be done in a group. Final project can be over almost anything that can be made political. R is difficult at times and can be frustrating, but he's always available over email or you can go to online office hours. He's very patient because he doesn't expect anyone to be an expert in R.

Professor Dawe absolutely wants his students to succeed. He knows that his students are not experts in R and makes sure to clearly walk you through each assignment. If you ever need help, Professor Dawe always made himself available outside of class. I was very worried coming into this course as I had hear bad things about 3780, but he made it easy
Was not very accessible for our class. Did not explain things very well in my opinion and I felt thrown into R. Pretty lenient though

Professor Dawe is nice, accessible outside of class, & wants you to succeed. However, the content is excruciating and more like a computer science & coding course rather than a statistics or data analysis class. In addition, all projects except for the final one are done in groups. So make sure that you team up with smart people who will work hard.

This class did not have mandatory attendance, but Professor Dawe still made himself very accessible outside of class to help students with any coding questions they had. No textbook was necessary, but you do have to watch lectures, and recitation is probably helpful as well for answering the trickier questions in weekly assignments!

Professor Roth is amazing! One of the best professors I've had during my time at OSU. You can tell she cares about the students and the material. She's very understanding the the topic can be hard and takes the time to ensure everyone understands. Since she's a PhD student, she seems to have more empathy for students. She is truly a great professor
Great Professor

She is super knowledgable and so sweet!! She is really understanding and the content is really interesting. You can tell she cares about her work. I definitely recommend if you want an interesting, easy and low maintanence polisci class!

Professor Roth is an amazing educator, is engaging & well-spoken. You're assigned readings before class, and you'll often have quizzes (multiple choice, t/f, short answer) at the beginning of the lecture. Taking notes is crucial for this class, as it's very fast paced, and it's easy to lose track of all of the information getting thrown at you.
Absolutely awesome professor, excellent at helping students learn and retain vital information despite the fast pace of a second session course!

Profressor Roth is so kind and caring to the students. She's always willing to help and gives amazing feedback on essays/exams/assignments. You can also tell she really enjoys the work and material she teaches which makes her lectures easy to understand and enjoyable!

Absolutely fantastic Professor. She gave very good lectures and was very easy to follow. She's often very engaging with her students and is always ready to help. Class structure is light on HW, its very focused on learning and understanding the information. The main brunt of the work is two big case studies you do. Would absolutely recommend her.

I learned a lot from this class and it laid the foundation for my future upper-level polisci classes. Being ready to participate more in class requires reading articles that are not very long. The quizzes are not hard and you can find answers in assigned readings easily. Professor Calmettes is very caring and not a tough grader.

You'd get the most out of Calmette's class if you already have a lot of political science experience as the lectures are very complex and so are many of the jargon filled papers, he isn't always very brief. If you have that background though you can learn a lot and the grading is not harsh.

He is very note heavy so if your notes are no good, then your exam is going to be hard. You basically have to remember the core of what each lecture was about and if you forget it you're screwed. This class was extremely hard for a 2000 level course. I felt like when he graded assignments, he had a bit of an ego where he's brilliant but you're not
Terrible, just terrible professor. Do not take his courses.

Great professor, knows a ton and cares about students. Assignments can be challenging, but you're really pushed to think for yourself and he offers lots of help in office hours. Super interesting and useful intro class, even if you don't study foreign policy.

For being a three credit hour course, he takes it a little too far. Nobody had any idea what would actually be on exam and exam questions were not clearly mentioned on study guide. It was kind of a hopefully I retained this information that he said once during this lecture type deal.

Professor Ray is passionate about foreign policy but at times comes off as very pretentious during his lectures. He is also a pretty harsh grader, especially with the two memo assignments. There are weekly reading quizzes which aren't bad as long as you read. Some classes will be really interesting and other will be boring, kinda hit or miss.

Ray is a very good lecturer that really tried to make sure you understand the world of international relations and american foreign policy. Very engaging and can be surprisingly funny. His papers are rather difficult however and there is quite a bit of reading and quizzes to do. Does offer Extra Credit. Would highly reccomend

Memos had no guideline and were harshly graded. Lectures could be good but slightly pretentious. Reading quizzes went up day of. Final/midterm were mix of multiple choice and short responses. Course content at times veered away from foreign policy. Would not take again, which is very rare for me.

He only rolls out quizzes 1-2 hours before class starts and those quizzes are due 5 minutes before class starts, because apparently he thinks this is your own only class. The memo assignment is designed for you to fail, he is a very harsh grader on this assignment. The readings are very hard to understand and also boring.

He has readings before every class that were accompanied by difficult reading quizzes. He never sent out rubrics so the papers we had to write were difficult and he is a harsh grader. Worst of all he missed a day of class and got rid of our exam review day in order to go over a pointless lecture at the end of the semester.

Prof. Ray is extremely passionate about the subject matter AND about his students. Yes, he expects a lot, but there is no way to do badly in his class as long as you genuinely try, go to office hours, and show him that you're improving. He's SO understanding of mental health/personal life stuff and is really helpful if you just ask! He's funny too.

Attendance is semi-mandatory. He grades toughly but is clear is what his expectations are. Reading quizzes are easy and a good way to pad out your grade. Interesting lectures and clearly knows what he is talking about. Readings are not overwhelming.

I loved taking his class in Spring 22. He clearly knows his stuff, he actually cares about his students, he makes his lectures interesting/entertaining, and his assignments are worthwhile. The more you participate, the more you get out of his class. His grades are a little tough, but fair. Plenty of xtra credit opportunities. Take a class with him

Very good intro to foreign policy class- definitely geared towards people with a passion or interest in the subject. His teaching really makes you think about decision making, and you have to push yourself to do well- not an easy class due to the expansive amount of content. Class is mainly reading quizzes, a paper and 2 exams.
Best professor at OSU so far. Truly valuable of class even if you do not have much to do with foreign policy. So much to learn from him and his lectures.

I suffer from general anxiety, and he is probably the most cooperative professor I've ever met when it comes to the matter. He shows a true passion for his subject matter and sharing it with his students

Ray is just an absolute gem of a person. He is so thoughtful, caring and accommodating. I love who he is as a person, despite him being an insanely tough grader. The real issue here is the content. This class is incredibly difficult. There are mountains of readings, slides, and terms that even open note quizzes and tests can't prepare you for.

Foreign policy isn't my strong suit so I knew this class would be a challenge. Takes a good amount of engagement with the material to succeed. Lectures can be dense, note-taking has to be a strong suit. Good prof who cares about his students, just wasn't the most interesting class I've taken. Like foreign policy? Take this. If not, be prepared

I was honestly not expecting this course to be as valuable as it was. Not only does Professor Ray give you a great base in terms of foreign policy, he teaches you a lot of important skills in terms of writing, formulating your argument, and more. The lectures can definitely be a lot, but its a super rewarding and you truly learn a lot.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. There is a lot of reading, and he is a rather tough grader, but he is also very helpful with feedback. I would say only take this course if you're actually interested in foreign policy. The man is a great lecturer, and if you care about this stuff, you're going to get a lot out of this class.

Professor Ray is one of the best instructors I have had so far throughout my college career. He is a very tough grader but it made me think significantly more about the content of the class, as opposed to someone who just gave completion credit or graded with minimal effort. He obviously cares about his students' lives in and out of the classroom.

Professor Ray is an amazing lecturer and gives great feedback. Some people have been saying that he comes off as arrogant or condescending, but I did not get that impression at all. He just expects a lot from his students and encourages them to think through difficult concepts. The class is very reading-heavy and attending the lectures is crucial.

Go to office hours! He is a professor who will respect/help you more if you show him you care about your grade and his class. Don't hesitate to ask for help before memos/midterm/finals. Really knowledgeable and cares about foreign policy issues today. History heavy. For poly sci majors, this class will be a great foundation for future classes.

He's very passionate and clearly knowledgeable about what he teaches and expects you to thoroughly engage with the content. Hes very understanding too. Most grades are from reading quizzes and a couple papers throughout. Shouldn't take this class unless youre genuinely interested in foreign policy, but if you are and you care youll love it.

Really awesome and rewarding. Chris makes you think for yourself, but is super accessible and encouraging in office hours. He pushes you hard and grades hard, but there are ways to make up points. It's tough at first because you can't get away with bsing lol, but I honestly got more out of it than any class I've taken at OSU.

he is not a great teacher. He is condescending, and does not help with assignments. He grades papers really hard with little help (fights you), makes you read large articles with hard quizzes every week, and is not helpful in office hours. I would not take this course, especially if you aren't passionate about foreign policy.

Professor Ray seemed to be condescending in each of his lectures. Opinions that students gave were often dismissed if they did not meet what he thought to be the correct answer. My frustration reached its peak when assignments were given with little to no guidance. Make sure to attend lecture if you don't want to fall behind.

I really wouldn't recommend taking this class. I felt stupid in writing papers for his class. He's a really tough grader and likes arguing/challenging people. He definitely knows what he is teaching however, his delivery method is so hard. He also has the worst comments ever.
I've never disliked a professor so much. Extremely arrogant and very tough grader.
Greatest professor at OSU!

I do recommend taking an intro to politics before taking this class as Professor Ray can use some unfamiliar political terms. He is a tough grader and will challenge you, but it is definitely worth it! He was my most understanding professor during COVID-19 crisis. Daily quizzes, do not miss class and do the readings

This class really was informative and I enjoyed the content presented. Its a lot of reading but it is worth it. Ray was very flexible and it was obvious he cared about his students and that he loved teaching. If he taught more courses I would happily take them.
Ray is brilliant- but he also expects you to be brilliant. Great during office hours- grading is rough. Quizzes for a reading every class- learned a lot, just wish i would have done a little better.

Quizzes can be challenging and there are quite a lot of reading, but he's a good teacher whose lectures and assignments made me think about foreign policy in a completely new way. I really enjoyed his classes!
Lecture style is awkward and pretentious. Grading scheme is clear.
One of my favorite classes at OSU.
DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Three exams: the first one had a class average of 75, with a 10% curve, and one paper worth 25% each. Tests weren't too hard but were graded very strictly. Nice professor, and if you go to office hours, will give you extended feedback on paper. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT; it is worth an extra 5%. Attendance is not mandatory, but go, or you will fail.

I do NOT recommend taking this course. 350 characters is not enough to  explain my distaste for it. The entire class is based off 4 grades. 3 exams and an absurd 10-13 page research paper. The content was dull, it felt like being back in my high school history class. She spends half of it pretending she's back in Congress. Save yourself the trouble

The content of the class was not difficult at all. The teacher obviously had a lot of knowledge and experience on the topics, but the lectures were 100% her reading off the slides. There are three non-cumulative tests, all based on the slides. To do well, just memorize the slides. There is one ten-page paper at the end with a pretty vague prompt.

Professor Ritchie is THE WORST professor I have ever had. Everything I "learned" from Professor Ritchie can be found on a Wikipedia page and read within 5 minutes. If I was asked about Professor Ritchie I would honestly say I'd rather EAT A BAG OF NAILS then take another disaster class of hers. I attend every class i could and still barely passed.

Professor Ritchie was amazing! She share lots of personal stories that helped us understand the material more and the discussions we had in her lectures were very engaging. I felt the exam and paper were all very fair. Overall and amazing class

Graded by 3 non-cumulative exams and a long paper. Tests were fair and pretty much completely based on the powerpoint notes. I found the research paper to be relatively straightforward for an upper level class but apparently others didnt so maybe its not the best course if youre a weak writer? But easy class and nice professor imo

Class only had 4 grades. 3 exams and a 10-13 page research paper. Papers were graded hard. Exam difficulty was around a 7 (out of 10). DONT take as a filler class or a gpa boost. Definitely gotta work hard for a decent grade in the class. Terrible grade structure. 4 HIGH STAKES assignments entire sem. is not conducive to learning students success.

The grade relied on three exams and one paper that had a very vague prompt and felt like it was graded like I am a PhD candidate. The lecture style was awful and I learned next to nothing in this class. Awful and I will try my hardest to never take a class with her or the TA again.

She is clearly a really smart person who has lots of experience in politics. Her lectures weren't mandatory but it is very recommended to go to them because the 3 exams and 1 long paper that they're based off of is your entire grade. If you don't pay attention or study, you most likely will not do well here. Paper prompt was pretty awful.

Lectures are interesting and easy to follow bc she just goes off the slides. Only grades are 3 tests and a paper, which sucks if you dont do well on the exams. The exams are hard compared to how easy the lectures are. Paper is the hardest Ive ever written as well. Professor Ritchie is super nice and insanely smart just not an easy class.

Dr. Ritchie's course is graded by 3 exams and 1 paper. If you show up to class and review her slides, her exams are easy. She also gives more than enough time for the research paper. Her lectures are interesting and easy to follow- just go to class and you will do really well. She is a really caring professor and happy to help outside of class too.

This class is the worst political science class offered. While the lectures are undoubtedly easy to follow, she reads word for word off the 100 slide lecture to then always go off topic about her personal experience in Washington. THESE EXAMS ARE GARBAGE. These exams were so ridiculously long and difficult compared to the most laid back lectures.

I have been a straight A student since freshman year of high school. This class crushed my spirit. I genuinely think this professor is sadistic because he actually said nobody gets an A in his class during syllabus week. I should have seen the warning signs.

Class average was a D on both midterm and final. The guy was laughing as he was handing back our midterms. He genuinely takes pleasure in screwing over his students by testing them on definitions that aren't even on his slides! He expects us to memorize 70 definition questions and 21 extended response questions for the final WORD FOR WORD.

If you write your exam answers in your own words and do not write verbatim what he has on his slides, you WILL receive a low grade for each question. Your answer could mean the exact same thing as what he has on his slides, but you will NOT receive credit. Some questions aren't even on his slides, so how can we write verbatim for those? Terrible.

Really good professor. His teaching style goes a little off the average OSU professor, which is why it upsets people. Lectures are enjoyable, and the material is heavy just like his grading for exams, but it is not that deep. Genuinely a funny and enjoyable professor and his accent has nothing to do with it. Recommend the class a 100%

Verdier is a great professor, i highly recommend. The class is lecture heavy but not hard. He gives you all the potential questions for the midterm and final. All the people who gave bad review either didnt follow his advice for studying, didn't put in the effort, or are butt hurt to hear the reality of the US and its role in international econ.

THESE REVIEWS DO NOT DO HIM JUSTICE. Class is really not that bad. If you ask him he will tell you exactly what he is looking for on the exams, as long as you memorize that its an easy A. He is probably the funniest professor I have ever had. French Mr. Rogers. I always look forward to going to lecture as they never fail to brighten my day.

Verdier is hilarious, I love his class. People who say he is difficult at grading are over-exaggerating. He gives a study guide before tests, and though his definitions are sometimes ambiguous, he gives leeway in grading in the same way. If you study, you'll be fine, I got 100 on the midterm, + there's a curve at the end of the class, dont worry.

Professor Verdier does not understand that not every undergrad has a Doctorate. His tests are extremely difficult and he grades extremely harshly. If you can avoid this class, it might be better for your mental health.

Professor Verdier is a joy in class. He is one of the foremost experts on political finance systems and often his classes and what he teaches will be insanely difficult. Class participation is key, if you ask questions and study his powerpoint you should do well in class. As long as you reach out to him, you'll be okay.

Spare yourself from this professor at all costs. I only managed to finish with an A because half the class was failing. Not only is he vague and confusing in what he expects for assignments and tests, but he literally REFUSES to elaborate when we ask questions, and makes us feel stupid for not reading his mind. Also frequently contradicts himself.

Terrible. One of the worse experiences of my life. His grading is not clear at all. I have never been so confused by a professor in my life. His tests are just stupid. They're based off of definitions or topics that he never went over or aren't in the textbook. I was so excited to take this class and was thoroughly disappointed.

I wouldn't wish this man on my worst enemy. He was the worst professor I have ever had. He is not transparent with grades and thinks all of us have doctorates in this topic like he does. If you have to take it, my only advice is to make a study group. That is the only way you'll make it through. It's a miracle I got a B.

Exams are hand written using lots of definitions. He wants all the definitions are stated in the class but many aren't defined or explained in class. The questions are given ahead of time, but the answers change each time you ask him. The answer to the questions are a moving target.

Terrible Professor. If u want to be quizzed on the definitions of things that are not defined within the course material sign up. If u want to be thoroughly confused, sign up. If you want to here an elderly man prattle on about economics incoherently, sign up. Im all for your freedom to choose, if your a masochist go for it.
Half of the class failed the midterm, avoid at all cost.
Little experience outside academia. Very strong accent, shows up late to his own class. Power points are confusing so are grading expectations.

Just another example of a career academic shoving globalist propaganda down the throats of their students. One comment on this professor is particularly striking that he is thought regressive. I second this, room for debate not accepted instead continual liberal talking points substantiated by poor data selection.

Probably one of the most disorganized professors at OSU. Confusing lectures that make no sense, lack of structure, lack of clear grading criteria. Avoid if you can. Classes are taught on broad basing generalizations such as "trade has no long term effects on employment" lack of sources and credibility. Professor confuses himself and us.

Took Poli sci 4381 with him spring of 2021 and my god that was the most difficult thing I have ever done in my entire life. I would have rather graduated late than take this class if I had known what was to come. Constantly contradicts himself during lecture sometimes I feel like he doesn't even know what he's teaching himself. just don't do it...

If you don't have to take Game Theory with this guy don't. He is not knowledgeable in the subject nor is he a good teacher. He frequently confuses himself in class said he doesn't like teaching the class nor does he like the subject and even that he failed it in college himself. My class had to make our own study guide and study sesh for the final.

Despite its lack of prerequisites, this class quickly delves into game theory's advanced mathematical concepts: Bayesian belief updating, infinite series, and strategy optimization. Dr. Verdier is a wise professor, but the grading is tough. To succeed: start the problem sets early, ask questions, and read the textbook. There was a generous curve.

Having friends in this class is the only way you will survive. The problem sets will take you hours, even in a group, and sometimes, he teaches concepts wrong and then doesn't correct himself. I learned a lot about game theory, but I feel like there's a better way to teach it than what Dr. V does. If you take this class: good luck, take good notes.

Dr. Verdier's International Comparative Political Economy is the best course I took over the course of my undergraduate years. The course was so well organized and material very dense that you will learn so much in the field of IPE. If you put in the work you will enjoy the intellectual challenge in this course.

I constantly found myself researching new terms and concepts, and often felt in over my head. Despite this, this class was one of my favorites. If you want an easy elective that will give you an easy A+ with no studying and no lectures, this is NOT for you. Attendance was not mandatory. Incredibly thought provoking class, really smart guy.

His class is extremely difficult. I managed to get an A-, however it required a ridiculous amount of studying. Like preparing upwards of 10 essays for an exam with only 3 of them as options to choose from. This class caused a lot of tears during finals. Also, 1% of your overall grade is lost for EVERY absence. Absolutely do not recommend.

Professor Verdier is one of the best professors I have had. He is extremely knowledgeable and witty, and genuinely cares about his students and their comprehension of the difficult material. Although the class was one of the hardest I've experienced, you can do well if you work hard. Also, his dry sense of humor makes that class that much better.

Took everything in me to do well in his class. While Professor Verdier is an affable person and makes the class environment enjoyable, the readings are outdated (and there's an obscene amount to read) and exam questions can be vague. Make sure you know what you are getting into before taking this class.
Great professor! Super funny and has a great French accent--honestly a silver fox. Also makes lectures interesting and the class is easy to do well in.

Daniel Verdier is a great human being, but his classes are not to be reckoned with. By far the hardest class I have taken at OSU. Get ready to read a whole lot because he assigns reading quizzes. His exam study guide are too much. For example, he expects you to know 100 identification questions, 20 theory questions, 10 possible essay questions.

Mr. Verdier is a cool guy, and a unique individual.  I was skeptical at first, as to whether his lectures made much sense because he was all over the place, however i would ask specific questions that i believe were very complex and he gave great responses.  He's very respectful, intelligent, and funny which compensates for his super hard class!

He's singlehandedly the worst professor I've ever had. He rambles, assigns over 200 pages of reading, forgets the main points and confuses you, and makes you memorize all of the material but only tests you over 25% of it. Avoid him at all cost.

Dr. Verdier's class was one of the toughest I've taken at OSU. The material is very dense and his lectures are full of information. However, you can learn a ton from this class if you pay attention and go to lecture. The tests are super difficult but manageable if you put the work in. He curves as well. Overall, a really rewarding class .

Verdier has very limited analytic capacity, which makes him extremely ill suited for a graduate theory class. My fellow students made the class much more fruitful than the professor did. In fact, Verdier's interventions ruined many discussions that could have become profound and thought-provoking. His general attitude is intellectually repressive.

this is not a good class to take the qrt b4 u graduate. its one of those classes u need to teach urself as the proff is very vague. thought i was going to fail class for awhile, but grading ended up being lenient on TA's part. not a class warranting dropping,or delaying graduation for tho. just do the work and shut up

The class is very intellectually stimulating but also very hard. His tests are the hardest that I have ever take and very vague. Do not let it scare you because you will learn a ton of stuff that most econ majors wouldnt even know.

Not for the faint of heart, people allergic to word problems, the impatient, people who enjoy leisure time during the weekends...But when you finish, you're probably more equipped to solve Game Theory problems than an Econ major. Even if you are border-line failing the course.

The fact is that Game Theory is pretty tough but also pretty interesting. Verdier, while sometimes vague, did an overall good job introducing us to the concepts. Yes, the problem sets are very challenging. But this is a unique Political Science class and I do think I learned quite a lot from the class. On the whole I enjoyed it.

Avoid this professor. Homework assignments are impossible, tests are vague and badly worded, he is hard to understand and thinks that everyone in the class is an idiot. Will not even entertain the thought that everyone failing and more than 2/3 the class dropping was his fault. One girl chose not to graduate rather than finish the class. AVOID HIM!

Avoid this professor. Homework assignments are impossible, tests are vague and badly worded, he is hard to understand and thinks that everyone in the class is an idiot. Will not even entertain the thought that everyone failing and more than 2/3 the class dropping was his fault. One girl chose not to graduate rather than finish the class. AVOID HIM!
Avoid at all costs.  Hardest  poli sci class I've taken at OSU

I absolutely loved this guy! Lots of reading but not unlike most 500 level poli sci courses. If you attend lectures and keep up with reading class should be an easy A. He's wondefully knowledgeable and has a funny but dry sense of humor. If you're interested in the topic, definitely take his class.
I would be weary of taking this class.
Absolutely fantastic!  It requires a lot of work to do well, but I got a lot out of the class.  He's wonderfully intelligent.
This man rocks the world, there is an aura about him.  Don't bother taking this class if you are easily frightened off by brilliance.

he goes over things very vaguely and quickly, promotes his own theories (even though they don't make sense), gives you exams that are one question and lets you write for hours, but when all is said and done, you learn more than you thought you would.
avoid if at all possible.

Professor Finch was good, I took his class online but he always provided feedback on his grading. There are four papers you write on class material of your choice, alongside discussions and quizzes. Pretty easy class, just do the readings and you'll be fine.
Great guy, very liberal and he can go on rants about struggles and marginalization, but passionate guy who understands your concerns
The class is quiz and exam heavy with some papers. They are very easy and not graded too harshly as long as you pay attention to lectures that are posted online.

Brian was cool. I was hesitant at first because this was the first semester that he taught. The material was in the notes but I felt that his class was lecture heavy. If you do bad on the first two you wont get a good grade. I struggled a lot in his class but he responded well. Hes nice but i think he just needs more experience.

Brian was alright as a professor. Definitely just lectured directly off the slides and you aren't graded on much. Theres weekly participation quizzes that are pretty easy but the exams rely really heavily on the readings rather than the lectures. Theres only 3 overall assignments so your grade is exam based.
A very esay A! Choose him!
Angel professor!

Took this class asynchronous and it was very straightforward. Eight quizzes and three tests were all the grades. There weren't many trick questions and the grading scale allows for leniency (85+ is an A). Would definitely recommend if you need to fill out credit hours.

Very concise class. Questions can be tricky but graded on a scale where an A is a 85 or higher so there's breathing room. Overall didn't have to spend much time on this class and never had to interact with Professor Kurtz, but can still recommend this as a 2nd session course.

Quizzes and tests were the only graded components of this class. If you also get test anxiety, I would not be worried about this. Quizzes/exams were open book/note/lecture. Some questions did make me thinks, but I did not sweat the bulk of them. I recommend this as a GE or GPA booster. It was also a second session, 3 cr. hr course which was sweet.

Dr. Kurtz's class is well organized and an easy-A. However, his lectures can be super long and very boring. He'll talk for 10 minutes about something that could be discussed in 2 minutes. The reading for each week is heavy, but you can get away with skimming. Responsive to emails. Would recommend for an easy GE.

Professor Kurtz is extremely knowledgable in his field. He has worked extensively in different fields of political science, and doesn't seem to ever be wrong. He is one of the best teachers I have had!

Kurtz knows what he is talking about. You will learn a lot in his course, but you have to pay attention. Attendance isn't recorded, but it's a lot easier to understand the material if you're present. Only had four grades the whole semester (four tests). He answers any questions and is always available. I recommend the professor and the course.

If you like political science, he is the professor for you. But if you are just looking for a GE, there are better options. Lectures can be incredibly boring, but tests are easy & he supplies study guides.

Prof. Kurtz manages to convey information very well. This class was quite difficult, as I only managed to get a C on the first midterm, but after talking to him about it I got my grade up to a B+ by the end of the semester. Very fun class!

Great professor. I just loved the way he talked and it was my most favorite class taken so far. Although an easy GE, he actually made me interested in the subject. I looked forward to every class. Also, it wasn't hard with only a few hours of studying before each midterm.

Prof. Kurtz is probably one of the best, if not the best, instructor I've ever had. He's very informed and the love for his subject really comes out. Lectures are not necessary since he posts slides online, but they're so interesting and his lecture really adds to the material/experience. Tests are somewhat difficult, but deservingly so. Recommend!

Took him my first semester here, and by far my favorite professor thus far. Easy going, often makes extra office hours to help students, and funny at times. Gives 3 tests, final exam is a take home essay. Gives study guide with everything to be expected on the test, so if you know you're stuff you will do great. & his grading scale goes by the 20's

Great professor. He loves what he teaches, which makes lectures more interesting. Material can be pretty tricky at times, but he is very good at explaining it. Exams are hard. He gives you a study guide with anything that might be on it. Overall  he is a great professor but his class is difficult. He knows this and will tries to minimize stress.

Great professor who is actually interested in teaching. Lots of reading but he explains it all in class. He gives you the questions that are going to be on the midterms, which are super easy. Pay attention in class and you're set

Super informative. Well spoken, easy to follow. Some complex material at times. Lectures are overall interesting and he keeps your attention (if you care at all about the subject matter). Your grade comes from midterms and exam which are all long answeressay but he tells you what to know and provides study guides!!! Most should get an A or B here!

He's a nice guy but his lectures are SOOO boring. The exams are pretty difficult as well. There's two midterms and a take home final, they are mostly IDs and an essay question. He gives the questions that are on the midterms before so that's a positive. Grading is done by the TA.

The Professor is great, but the grading (done by the TA) is unfair and completely subjective.  The exams are ids and essays, and getting an A truly depends on luck.  Seriously, the person next to you might have the exact same answer with ten higher points.  I would recommend this class if you're OK with getting a B for handing in A work.

Kurtz turns complex hazy topics into something all students can understand. And he manages to do this with humor and interest. He is helpful and loves asking students for opinions. Exams questions are given beforehand but the grading is slightly subjective and tough. Take thorough notes on the computer and you can get by skimming the readings.

Kurtz is one of those unique teachers in the world who knows how to teach a complex subject in a humorous and thought-provoking manner. You're graded on 3 exams and attendance is not mandatory. He gives a study guide for the exams which helps but they are not graded that easy. Only needed to buy a $12 book but there lots of required readings online
Absolutely awesome professor- would take him again, for sure! made class interesting every day...i learned SO much in this class...he is the best professor i have ever had!

Prob my favorite prof ever! It's not an easy class. Go to it, and listen carefully. He gives the 5 sides of every argument so it's impossible for know his opinion. I learned a lot though, and have used this info in other classes. Also slept through and exam, and he was so sweet about calming me down and letting me make it up.Depends on your interes
Best Poli Sci I've taken, and that's saying a lot.  Funny, engaging, and relevant.  Exams are easy because of study guide.

He is really funny, brilliant, and you learn a ton. In class discussions are alright,and he won't make you stay if he doesn't have anything else to say.   Sometimes I had the tendency to fall alseep during his class though. Essays are very thorough (you can't just memorize info), but his study guides are helpful.

This class can be very interesting... my only problem is the insane grading.  TA's grade everything and it seems so difficult to do well in this class, I mean come on... it's only a 100 level course.  Make sure you include every detail on exams... again, it was an interesting class.

Best professor/class I've taken at OSU! He is really funny, brilliant, and you learn a ton. In class discussion are awesome,and he won't make you stay if he doesn't have anything else to say. Tests and quizes are very thorough (you can't just memorize info.), but his study guides are helpful.

Best professor. Always wanted to go to class, lectures were very interesting. Learned a lot. Exam questions given out before, but he'll give you 6, VERY extensive ones, and only choose 2. They are also very complex. Grading is fair, though, and our class an A was from 80-100%. Also, too much reading

This was one of the best classes I've taken at OSU.  This guy is brilliant and I wish I weren't graduating so I could take more classes from him.  He really knows his stuff and teaches you how to think for yourself.

I really liked this professor.  He turnes the gobly gook of the reading into layman's english better than most professors that I've had in polysi.  Very interesting and while his tests aren't easy, he gives good study guides and I even had a  take home.

He is very enjoyable, and inclass discussions are very entertaining.  He can go on tangents at time and some stuff you will talk about you will never need to know, so can be hard to take notes at times, but before tests he always gives you a good Study Gu
LOVED HIS TEACHING! He is so intelligent and I loved everything he had to say and learned a great deal from him. I hope to take another class from him in the future. Take this CLASS!
Does not explain all of the information in a concise and clear manner.

He was an awesome teacher.  Lecture was never boring.  I never wanted to miss class because I didn't want to miss out on learning from him.  He gives you everything you need to do well in his class, tests arent too hard.  I highly recommend him!

Excellent instructor.  Mixes politics, society, and economics in a very well-rounded class that amazingly was never boring.  Despite the amount of info he throws at you, he presents it in a very clear and understandable manner.  Very smart guy.
Excellent Professor! I would recommend him to anyone and he is the best of the best!

Very interesting lectures. Very open minded to new ideas. Invites in class discussion. His tests really make you think. Very excited about his field, which helps you pay attention. Oh, and he's hot ;-)

EXCELLENT lectures, DO NOT miss any of them!! very interesting class, very intelligent and bright professor, grading scale reflects the difficulty/amount of content.  do everything on study guides, even if you don't use it on the exam you will learn more!

I can't reccomend him enough. Excellent teacher. Our class was the politics of developing nations, and where I entered into it expecting to be bored, he made it come alive. This man hopefully will be around for a long time, teaching, because he is great.
There is a lot of info to take in, but his test are really easy.  The grading scale is phenomenal!  He is kind of cute in a teacher sort of way.
Very knowledgeable, structures lectures well.
very informative...learned the most in his class compared to every other OSU class i've taken. Take notes.
No Comments

Acs is an amazing professor in my personal opinion. Some do not like how slow he speaks in class but he wants to make sure everyone is able to understand and succeed. The course is graded by 2 exams and an optional extra credit paper/presentation on a topic you pick based on course content. I wish he taught more than 3 classes! 10/10!!!

> Class is useful for understanding how laws are created and implemented. Lectures were useful and well-organized.
> READING IS REQUIRED to pass the class. The midterms consist of T/F, multi choice, and shortanswer questions which directly reference readings. You NEED to reread.
> Grades: 30% Quizzes, 30% Midterm, 40% Final. 1-5 ex credit points

Professor Acs' assigned readings for each class, each of which were pretty easy. He had pop tophat quizzes for attendance, but you could miss a few without penalty. Two exams, each based on information in the lecture slides, but he rarely covered the slides during lecture and instead went off on random tangents.

I've had Acs for 3500 and 3115. Classes are incredibly boring; he's not the best lecturer and if you want a grade that's higher than a C, go to class, read everything, and study constantly. The only benefit is that there is a group project at the end of the semester, and he grades that leniently. Very mid.
The Professor is great, but he doesn't know how to explain the material and his classes and readings are boring.

The professor is knowledgeable, but there seems to be an assumption that students in this introductory-level class share his same level of knowledge. Lectures are painful to sit through and the readings are incredibly dull. Only four grades all semester.

Only graded on 4 assignments (30% Midterm, 30% Final, 20% Reading Quizzes, 20% Group Project). Extremely dry, boring content, kind of assumes everyone has an advanced level of knowledge even though there are no pre reqs to the class. Exams are unnecessarily difficult - both the midterm and final had to be curved by 20 points each.

Final grade is only based on two exams, reading quizzes, and a group project. The class is pretty difficult, he had to curve the midterm and final for a decent amount of points, think 10-20. The lectures can be boring but he does a decent job teaching, willing to answer questions, and is overall a pretty chill professor.
Class was super easy. One reading quiz a week which was common sense if you read the book. Curves the midterm and final a LOT. Highly recommend for a GE and he was super nice.

Lecture could be dry at times, but I still liked this class. Just a midterm and final (both administered online), final paper, and pop tophat quizzes based on the readings. He has students best interests at heart and everything was pretty straightforward.

Alex was an excellent lecturer. Insightful, even handed, and willing to answer questions and have a discussion. The class was based mostly on the midterms, final and paper, but he gave a generous curve and graded fairly. I really enjoyed this class.

This class is unnecessarily tedious and difficult. Endless amount of policies to choose from to study, and this prof seemingly picks the most boring topics possible. Doesn't give clear guidelines or content of exams, the quizzes don't even match the readings, and was pretentious with occasional out of pocket things said. -900/10, don't recommend.

This class was pretty easy, if you took high school gov you're off to a good start. I really liked Prof Acs, and though I probably could've gotten an A while skipping some lectures, I genuinely enjoyed being there. Classes kind of feel like a casual chat but he does teach the material well. Funny, chill, will lightly make fun of people.

Many questions are completely ambiguous or have conflicting information which makes the midterm luck-based. Everyone ran out of time, average was initially an 80%. Now it's a 78%, and we're confused whether he curved it down? No lecture recs, mandatory attendance, midterms open at 9AM for 1 hour, & no slides released until weeks after his lectures.

Professor Acs is a really great professor. He is clear about what his expectations are for your assignments. There are 2 midterms, 1 final. Lots of extra credit opportunity and he also curves almost all the exams. He is very smart and yet is easy to learn from as he explains things flawlessly. He is also funny and really nice!

Aces clearly loves the information he is teaching, the class had only three test- which he curved and extra credit was able to be given. There was a textbook- but I never bought it. I put this class on the back burner of 18 credit hours- not that it is easy, just never any commitment besides the three exams.

Your grade is determined based on the final and midterm exams. The exams are extremely hard he had to curve grades 12% because a lot of our class failed. Lectures are really boring. Wouldnt recommend this course or teacher. This intro class definitely hurt my gpa. Take with another professor if you can!

The only grade in the class is the midterm and final, which isn't an easy exam, but he does curve it! I would take it with someone else if possible, but have learned a lot. It is an intro level course, but is much harder than that. Other students in my class do not like him, but I do not mind him.

The only grade in the class is the midterm and final, which isn't an easy exam, but he does curve it! I would take it with someone else if possible, but have learned a lot. It is an intro level course, but is much harder than that.

He's a great guy who loves this topic, but you don't actually get through much content in the class because he talks about it all a little too much. Graded by three response papers, two exams, one final paper, and some reading quizzes. You really need to do the reading and it's very unclear exactly what he expects you to do in the papers.

Class is lecture heavy, though the slides are detailed so you can reread them. Her tests are a little harder so she grades on an easier system. Personally, I feel that she's pretty generous with her grading, and offers extra credit for attending classes. Very helpful if you go to her and ask specific questions about homework/final project.
Pretty easy class if you do the reading

Fair grader. There are no exams, just papers, but if you read the material and attend lectures, they're not difficult. There are weekly quizzes based on the readings, which average 15+ pages. There are two writing reflections, and he made the second optional. The lectures can be a little boring, but not the end of the world.

Reading heavy class, expect reading quizzes almost every single class. But the professor is nice, he cares about his students and gives a lot of advice for grad school. He's not a tough grader, overall if you read and go to class you'll pass.

I really enjoyed taking identity politics with Jose. He is super kind and explained the readings with such good detail and clarity. You can also tell he's very passionate about his work, which makes his lectures more enjoyable. He's also very funny, caring, and always willing to help students.
Amazing! He makes complicated subjects make so much sense. He is super understanding and not a very tough grader. Great to meet with outside of class because he is super helpful!

The readings can be a lot but that should be expected. They're very interesting and he fosters good class discussions and genuinely cares about his students and will ask for input on some class decisions. Well organized and mentally stimulating.

This class is certainly not easy, but Jose made it very enjoyable! You will be doing a lot of reading and researching so be prepared. My favorite part of this class is that he really was able to give a good look into the graduate school process. As someone applying to grad school I really loved this!

> Most of the content read in the papers is thoroughly explained in the class; the papers read are effectively support for the lectures, which are the main draw. You need to read for the midterm and final though; questions directly reference readings.
> Professor is REALLY fun and elevates the material significantly with his personality.

Prof. Wood is really funny and loves to call out students who don't participate. The class is tough for a GE, as there are only 2 exams and attendance for the grade. Make sure to READ every paper, as those are the exams. He's also a really respected political scientist outside of the university, so he knows what he's talking about. Loved this class

Wood is a top 3 PS professor at Ohio State. Attendance is mandatory, but if you don't want to go, then drop the class. Great and funny lecturer, extremely interested in the topics, especially for campaign. Reasonable grader, very easy to do well in his classes, whether that is the 2000 or 4000 level. Take any class he offers!

Tom is hilarious, and the lectures are enjoyable. The minimal amount of grades (2 exams and a paper) is frustrating, so if you do poorly on 1, it really sets you back. The paper was also challenging, and the expectations he set for the exams were unclear, so it's hard to know what to study. The exams were entirely on the readings, not the lectures.

He is a fun lecturer and tries to get students interested and engaged. However, you can tell most students are only there for a GE as most are checked out during his lectures. You NEED to do the readings for the exam and you NEED to show up to class. The only negative I would say is sometimes his jokes don't land and can come across as rude.

I loved the class. There was assigned reading but I didn't read much of it and I was absolutely fine on the exams. He explains concepts well and all the lectures were amazing. He takes attendance through TopHat and besides that, the only grades are the midterm and final. Be prepared for his jokes though.

Lectures are mandatory (him rambling to a presentation) with none of the material taught in the lecture being tested on. Only 2 exams (midterm and final) and then the attendance grade is taken from TopHat. The exams cover the readings that are read outside of class which you must read as the tests are based on a summary and understanding of them.
The professor is really funny but the lecture material was a bit boring. The only grades are midterm and final.

I really liked Tom. His lectures were super funny. The only thing I did not like about this course is that so much reading was required for the exams, but it was hardly ever covered in the lecture. I felt like the reading and lecture were almost different classes. Lectures we really enjoyable though and he made them really fun.

Heavy workload 2 or 3 articles to read each week out of class and notes to take during the lectures and the only grades were the midterm and the final. I think he must grade easily because I would go into exams feeling not well prepared and I got an A on both the midterm and the final. Professor Wood is entertaining and the class was fun to be in.

Overall and okay class. After the midterm you are quick to realize that the readings you do outside of class are all you need to focus on, the material in the lectures doesn't really matter, even though attendance is mandatory. Just a midterm, final, and attendance for grades.

Tom Wood clearly cares about the success of his students and does what he can to help them be successful. The class only had one midterm and a final, with points for attendance as well. Lectures are funny and enjoyable! He hands out a study guide before the midterm and final that greatly aid in doing well on them.

Thomas Wood is an amazing professor. He made his lectures fun by joking with students and interactive by asking many engaging questions. I would rate the difficulty of this class as average because he grades solely based on exams and attendance.

Lectures and readings were separate but intertwined in the topics they covered, so attendance as well as reading all of the many readings was a must for the two exams which were what the course was graded off of. Outside of that the grading was lenient and the topics were definitely made more interesting by the way Tom taught them.

I love Thomas Wood. He is so enjoyable and I wanted to study and do well in his class, as his hilariously subdued passion for the subject rubs off on his students. You'll be wanting to learn more about elections even if you're just taking this course as a GE. There is a lot of reading, as everyone says, but the concepts are usually straightforward.

Professor Wood is a really smart, funny person! He knows a lot about what he teaches and has a lot to say, but sometimes the class felt disorganized and all over the place. Really make sure you know the readings especially before the midterms and you'll be fine.

Dr. Wood is super engaging in class. Hes very funny and knowledgeable, but the lectures dont really help that much. Attendance is mandatory for them, but his posted readings are the keys to success. Read, and youll be fine! He is somewhat disorganized, so pay attention to the syllabus. Overall, a great class, be prepared for Dr Woods wit!

Dr. Wood ws so awesome this past semester and I enjoyed the class! He does make you use R, which he has a difficulty time teaching the basics of since he is so advanced. Definitely come to class, it's worth your time
Only grade was midterm and final. He dropped attendance points and strayed from what was stated in syllabus. Class was unorganized.
Tom is a fun, passionate professor and his class was my favorite of the semester. Hes not very well organized and his lectures are more conversational, which annoyed some students but I enjoyed.

Tom is hilarious, but his class is no joke. You're graded on reading checks and your midterm and final are also based on the readings. His lectures and exams are graph heavy and he doesn't do the best job of explaining them. His lectures are kind of all over the place but the readings are kind of all you need. As long as you read you're fine.

If you prefer some structure, steer clear of this professor. Although he is entertaining, the enjoyment faded around midterms when it became clear we were incredibly behind on material and prof. Wood did not show much concern that his studies felt unprepared. Class was chaotic and centered around debating current events for 40 minutes.
Tom wood is hilarious and taking his class online is a wild time. You get graded on 2-3 assignments so study. Super nice guy.

Tom is your classic research professor. Hes not really here to teach. While i find him hilarious and overall likable, he just doesnt really teach. The lectures are entirely useless, and the exam was based entirely on readings. He says you dont need to be able to interpret graphs, but this is not true. Taking his class is a stressful experience.

absolutely love this prof and excited to try to take a class from him again. lectures were genuinely interesting and hes very funny. there isnt many assignments but if you pay attention you should do well! only thing is its kind of hard to interpret the graphs but i did okay trying my best. overall one of the best classes ive taken!

i really didn't like him at first but he's really clear on how to do well on exams - go to class and study the past exams. i got a 98 on the midterm doing this. he was AMAZING with the transition to online classes. super responsive and understanding. he's very knowledgeable and i learned a lot in his class. the reading quizzes can suck so beware.

Tom Wood is a funny guy, but sometimes comes off as arrogant. His lectures are funny, especially with being Australian, but they dont pertain to or help with anything you will be tested or quizzes on. He says that you dont need to be good at interpreting graphs for this class but that isnt true if you want to get an A.
Really funny, he takes attendance each class, sometimes does pop quizzes.

Now that I'm graduating + can reflect back on all of my professors, I can confidently say that Tom Wood was by far the best professor I've had in my undergrad. I would highly recommend his classes to anyone, PoliSci major or not. He is absolutely hilarious + incredibly kind & accommodating. His was the class that I truly was excited about going to.

One of the best professors I've had. He's very knowledgeable and his lectures are amazing. There are pop quizzes, but you'll pass if you do the readings. He's very funny and well respected. His exams do have essay portions, but he does examples on review days. I wish I could take this class again.

Tom is great - I didn't need this class for my major but I had him last semester and I liked him so much I took this too. For PoliSci, it's a lot of reading, but it does help to prepare you for law school (since many of us want to go anyways). He's absolutely hilarious, easily accessible outside of class - he mkes it v easy to want to always attend

Loved this class! As long as you do the readings (which there are a lot of), you will be completely fine. He is hilarious and makes every lecture genuinely enjoyable to go to. Felt like I learned a lot from him. Also grades fairly and generously.

Dr. Wood is by far the best professor I've had at OSU. He is super funny, easy to understand, and studying for his exams is a breeze if you focus on learning the concepts from old exam questions. I would recommend this class to anyone, regardless of major, interested in learning fun tricks and facts about our country's political world.

Extremely knowledgable and makes his own graphs for lectures (many test questions are interpreting graphs). Do the readings or you won't pass!! Gives two pop quizzes over readings and prepares you well for midterm and final (multiple choice and extended response). Super funny and makes lectures interesting, prepare to have your mind blown.

If you dont read the assigned readings, you wont do well. The pop quizzes will happen when attendances starts to decline. He gives you 10 minutes tops and theyre usually 10 questions. Heres the kicker though, theyre all graph interpretation and you dont have enough time to actually read through everything.
Very good

Brings a really weird but exciting energy to class, probably the most fun to attend out of any I've taken after three years of OSU. He's also a brilliant man, and will teach you a ton about analyzing historical and contemporary political trends as well as statistics. You will need to do the readings, pay attention, and study hard to do well though.

If you read the articles and take notes you'll do well on the exams, if you don't read you won't understand anything since the lectures are sometimes completely unrelated. I wish someone would have told me to make sure to read before I took this because I blew it off until the first exam and then spent around 24 FULL HOURS catching up.

Tom is pompous and arrogant and it comes through very clearly when he teaches. His lectures are hard to understand and his study guides for exams are unhelpful. I was really looking forward to this class but unfortunately let down. It should not rated as a 2000-lvel course, it is taught and graded much more harshly.

I took Voters and Elections last semester with Professor Woods and it was by far the best course Ive ever taken here at Ohio State. Thomas Wood is a very respectable professor; hes extremely knowledgeable on the coursework, and is very engaging and entertaining. The information was valuable and interesting, but theres A LOT of reading.
He brings a fun energy to the class and is very engaging but at times can be kind of convoluted in his language. He really is good at teaching I learned a lot in his class.

Very knowledgeable pol-sci teacher. Keeps his biases to himself and he's actually quite humorous during lectures. His tests are over the assigned readings that are covered in class and he gives random pop quizzes if attendance gets low. He posts the answers to exams that his previous classes took which will honestly cover about 75% of your exams.

Took campaign politics, and he was such a great prof. Funny and informative during his lectures. Makes it clear in his syllabus on what you need for an A, so it is hard to argue a better grade, but if you show up and try its an easy class. One of the best PoliSci teachers at the school.

I took Voters & Elections from Professor Wood and really enjoyed the class. I thought he was hilarious and made the information interesting. He kept his bias to himself - I'm still not sure which political side he leans to, which I appreciate in a political science class. There is a lot of reading, but not from textbooks - he assigns articles.
Good professor, however he does tend to wander off topic.

A very interesting class. Well traveled, satirical, and Australian so he offers a unique perspective to American campaign politics. Readings are important to understand. Pro-tip: all you need to understand from the readings are the abstract and conclusion, don't waste your time. Just show up and participate and you'll survive.

Tom Wood is my favorite professor at OSU. Most interesting class I've taken. He is a hilarious Australian dad with uneven sideburns. If you show up to class and do the readings, you'll do fine. Can't wait to take his next class.

Great guy, interesting class.  People that complain either do not show up to lecture because of sporatic attendance checking, or simply got screwed over by one of the pop quizzes.  Just go to class, be aware, and skim the readings, and you will do very well.  My favorite course from last semester.

Tom's a nice guy. Good for some laughs. The class is simpler than it seems. His charts and graphs are confusing but the messages behind them are simple. Readings are a little long, but you just need to know the main idea. A lot of his exam questions come straight from lecture and the rest from the readings. Just read and go to class for an A or B.

This was one of the hardest classes I have taken & Ive taken numerous PS 4000 courses. In the beginning it doesnt seem too bad and the ads he shows are pretty cool. Tests are extremely hard and doesnt give a much time to complete pop quizzes. Lots & lots of stats... Class isnt even a stats class. Hard.

Great guy overall, Gets off topic sometime, but you will enjoy it. Does not use a textbook. HE IS AUSTRALIAN so it makes lectures 10 times more fun. Always available to talk, and he really loves to talk. Enjoys class participation. Ask him to draw a house. If you like graphs and reading, you'll get an easy A.

Best teacher I've had so far. His class is really entertaining and he is very knowledgeable in his field. If you pay attention you'll do fine. The workload isn't bad at all and he is a really fair grader.  He lectures a lot but he usually breaks it up by showing us campaign ads and talking about the election, so it's fun.

Thomas is a great guy. He is very clear with his lectures and makes sure students understand the subject. As long as you go to class you will do well. He is a really funny guy. I had him for 2 classes back to back and loved both.

Show up to lectures, which are interesting but sometimes not on topic the whole time, and you'll do okay.  He gives out a study guide for exams, and basically if you understand the gist of each pointtheory, you'll do pretty well.  I'd definitely take this again. He has a love affair with charts and a sometimes challenging Australian accent, though

He's off topic often and his accent is Australian, but he gets his point across and is very engaging and funny. You have to read and participation will always help, but he's a good guy in general. I liked this class a lot.

Tom is hilarious and has an incredibly dry sense of humor. He is really passionate about his subject which sometimes causes him to get off topic and discuss issues in his subject that we aren't really studying. The class was challenging but fair. You really have to pay attention.

Great guy. Funny and open to student questions. However, he is very disorganized. He over-complicates some simple concepts with very in-depth statistical analysis (if you are not good at stats, do not take this class!). Students really don't know what to expect. He has very few grades, leaving very little room for error. Participate in class!

This was his first semester at Ohio State, so naturally he was a bit disorganized. While that made the research paper more difficult than it needed to be, it was by no means impossible to do well. His accent and sense of humor are awesome if you can endure the random tangents. The articles that he assigns for reading are also insanely long.

If you have a basic statistic and political background, this class is quite enjoyable. He makes you work for your grade , but if you put in the time and effort your grade will reflect it. I have learned a lot about the course title, voters and elections. People who rate him as a bad professor must be unable to think intellectually.

After reading these reviews, it is clear to me that this guy is getting a bad rep.  It was his first time ever teaching so of course he at times was disorganized especially during the first part of the semester but he evolved.  He hid his genuine interest in the students with his quick wit and sarcasm.  You will learn a lot and get an easy B-A

Tom Wood was awesome. Does a thorough job of instructing the course and really loves political science and his job. Homework consists of lengthy articles, but if you can understand the themes of each you will be fine. Should definitely be interested in the history of American politics as well as elections if taking this class. Would take again.
It is a funny coincidence that SATAN and STATISTICS start with "s." By the way, it is not even a stats class.

AWFUL teacher. No Stats pre-req but he asks like there was. More of a statistics class than anything else. He commented that my papers were too in-depth so he took points off. He gives you 2 20-80 page articles to read that you cannot possible understand for every class. He is a smart guy but the WORST prof EVER. DO NOT TAKE.

Honestly, I have never been more frustrated with a person in my life. SO much unnecessary reading and he doesn't have a "point". Very disorganized.. If you don't have explicit amounts of prior knowledge about Politics and statistics you will be lost in lecture. Don't subject yourself to this class. (He's a nice guy don't get me wrong, but really)

This guy does not know what's going on any better than the students. The number of times students have corrected him on what he's saying is overwhelming. Once he talked about how often people get a certain knee surgery in Sweden or somewhere for a good 15 minutes and drew a diagram of it on the board.

He spends a ton of time on tangents and class discussions that are way off topic.  It's hard to tell whether material is important or not. You'll need the textbook because he'll give you a couple random reading quizzes during the semester. Other than that, the class is pretty standard. Midterm, paper, final.  The midterm was poorly formatted.
great prof. lectures were engaging and interesting - mainly just reiterate readings. 3 exams, 3 long papers, 3 short papers. pretty standard class and a good prof - sadly she is leaving

A tough grader, especially when it comes to exams and case studies (which is the main sources of grades). I recommend participating in the class, could be the difference between letter grades. Readings weren't bad. She also gives you a choice between a presentation, essay, and a one-on-one discussion for the case study. Do the one-on-one!

Professor Gurevich is a fantastic professor. Attendance is mandatory, but lectures are Socratic and engaging. I learned so much about a variety of topics in this course. There is so much to learn from her! Grades are fair, and there are plenty of opportunities for extra credit. I recommend this course over and over again!

Victoria is the best professor The Ohio State political science department has to offer. During the semester I was going through a mental health crisis and she was completely accommodating. She is so kind and funny and truly cares about the topic shes teaching. I wish her all the best in life tbh.

An amazing professor. The readings were long but not horrible to get through. She truly wanted every student to succeed and offered lots of extra credit. Classes were always interesting and I learned something new during every class. If you have the chance definitely take this class with Victoria she did an amazing job designing it.

Probably my least favorite professor I've had at Ohio State. She has absolutely no lesson plans, she spends the class talking with zero structure. She doesn't give feedback on exams and projects and expects your work to change the next time. I have never written a review here before but felt it necessary. She's too new.

Victoria is the best instructor I have ever had at Ohio State. She truly cares about her students. She is readily available to help despite being a grad student. You do 3 big case studies which can be time consuming but her criteria is very clear. The class is also super interesting and she is so passionate and informed on the topics
Awesome class with a knowledgeable professor. Interesting topics very relative to current times and gives you a lot of information to think about.

Victoria is the best!! This was her first-semester teaching, but she created the course herself and is very passionate. There's reading due for every class but it's engaging and easy to get through. Attendance is mandatory but she's super lenient. She's very nice and accommodating and so fun to talk. I would def take her again if I could!!

Best prof I had this semester. She created this course and really cares about it and seeing her students succeed. She is young and very accommodating. Lots of reading before each class, but they're interesting and prepare you for the lessons and tests. This class is project heavy. I would take any class of hers. Lots of extra credit too

I LOVED her shes awesome. Her class made me want to change my career. Shes so nice and really cares that we are learning. We did a little too much group work but it was her first semester teaching. She also made this class on her own. I really enjoyed the content even though you have to read a lot. She also is understanding w missed classes.

This class is amazing! So interesting, so discussion based and Victorias expectations are made very clear. If you follow directions, you'll be fine. She is super understanding and just a joy to be around. She actually came up with this class herself, so she is so knowledgable on everything in this class and welcomes questions. WONDERFUL class!!!

The professor resists critique, possibly removing negative feedback about her class on here. Issues include outdated readings, ineffective group discussions, rigid lectures, and defensiveness to constructive class input. Not a very tough grader at all and the class is overall pretty easy, it just feels like a waste of credit hours at points.

Kara was a down to earth instructor. She made the class enjoyable and was willing to accommodate students. The workload for the class was flexible as well and she let us decide what our workload was going to be.

Amazing class, amazing professor. Lots of reading but you can get away with skipping a lot of it. Class is mostly discussion and very little lecture so attendance matters. She cares about the subject and her students and it shows. You have to go out of your way not to get an A.

Very memorable and enjoyable class due to Professor Gelpi. The dogs and general wholesome attitude was made it a really enjoyable atmosphere. Although there is some tough readings and some of the statistics can be quite dry it never feel overbearing or stressful.

Prof Gelpi was awesome. His lectures were super engaging, his tests are not very feasible, and the final paper is graded by a TA. Additionally he gives crazy amounts of extra credit at the end of the semester for SEI's and other things.

Prof. Gelpi gives actually engaging lectures. 

Tests are super easy -- all memorization of terms and almost no application. He gives you the terms ahead of time.

Final paper was broken down throughout the year so it was easy to complete.

You can get 100 on his reading quizzes just by reading the title of the reading assignment.

This class is ok. Gelpi was rarely on time, impossible to reach, and overall disorganized. I only got an A in the class because of all the extra credit (4 pts for SEIS, and 4 pts for attendance). I didn't learn anything, which made writing a 12-page research paper difficult. The TAs grade them though so you'll get an A even if your paper is awful

Great professor! Really cares about students. Easy grader, if you think something was misgraded you can ask to change it.
