Not many assignments and they are easy and you'll learn. Few small assignments for participation, 2 exams (easy), 1 final paper that is broken up throughout semester. Plus he brings his dog!
Dr.Gelpi is very passionate about what he teaches and it definitely shows. He is willing to answer questions and help students succeed. He explains everything in detail and keep us entertained.

Lectures are sometimes boring but if you pay attention and take notes in lecture you'll do well on the exams. Reading quizzes are not hard because he goes over reading materials during lecture so even if you don't actually read you'll still get full points on the quizzes.

Pretty easy class while still learning a lot. Gelpi is a really good story teller so his lectures are pretty interesting. The review sessions before the midterm and final covered everything and the paper is broken down so its not very hard.

Attendance counts as extra credit & he brings a dog. Lectures are extremely boring. Second half of class after the midterm is more interesting. Paper is broken into parts so no stress to put all together. Exams are easy, he gives you a study guide & just know what he says. Hard to reach out of class. Quizzes are easy. Boring, but easy A.
Professor Gelpi is great! Nicest dude, really knows his stuff, very good lecturer. Hard to get a hold of sometimes, though.

I showed up to class 5 times the whole semester; the midterm, to turn in the different parts of the paper, and the final. You don't need to show up. He gives a study guide for the midterm and final and they are multiple choice. It was super easy and minimal time was put in out of class besides the paper.
Exams were tough. Paper has no clear grading criteria so its hard to know whats expected for a sizable chunk if your grade. Interesting guy, interesting topics, but be cautious with this class.

Really nice guy and he really wants you to do well. Very clear and interesting lecturer but also puts everything online. The paper was over a long period of time and in section so it guarantees a good grade. And the final exam was the easiest thing I have ever taken in college I was shocked. Highly recommend. (He also brings dogs to class!)

Prof. Gelpi lectures in a very understanding manner. His lectures are pretty basic and they are not hard to follow. Grading comprised of 1 midterm, 1 final, quizzes, and a final paper. Readings are not necessary and they are all available on Canvas. I highly recommend taking his class. Test grades are weighted quite heavily, so be sure to study!
He is awesome

Political science isn't exactly my strongest subject, but this was wasn't horribly difficult. If you really understand political science, the lectures probably aren't necessary. The information is all on the powerpoints, but I thought some of his lectures were really interesting. Tests were fair, and study guides were given out before each one.

Dr. Gelpi is a good professor and is very willing to help students. His only downfall is that he has a tendency to lecture directly from his powerpoint slides. This class is not hard, if you find PS4315 difficult and are studying polysci  int studies  you should probably change your major.

I learned shockingly little new information in class. Like, shockingly. Readings were helpful occasionally, but Dr. Gelpi spent most of his time in lectures rewording his slides so it sounded like he wasn't just reading from them. So not bad information necessarily, just horrendously, horrendously boring.

He is very boring and the lecture is just what's on the sides, there really isn't reason to go to class especially since the TA does all the grading and comments. Also the exams are very short. 3 ID terms and 2 essays, missing one brings the exam down, and with only 3 grades , midterm, final, and paper its do or die.  Avoid this class and teacher!
very interesting lectures, just very few grades

Lectures are hard to dissect when it comes to what's necessary for the exam. Slides are sparse + readings/study guides are meaty. While the subject matter is interesting, very few students are confident about their ability to do well based on the blurred class structure. She is very nice and approachable, but the class is likely to drop your GPA.

I've had Dr. Watson for 4285 and 4280. This class and her others are lecture heavy and exams are based on those as well as the corresponding readings, but she is a very dynamic lecturer.  You often fall a class or so behind so be ready for changes. She is also very accomodating and understanding with her students.

Very kind, took 4285 with her last semester, definitely cares about students in and puts effort into prepping for lectures. However, she seems like she has too much on her plate. Syllabus was thrown away, class regularly cancelled, and by the time I had written the final essay, she had gotten rid of the assignment as a whole and ended the class.

Extremely nice & knowledgeable yet unorganized & all over the place. She cancels class and changes the syllabus and due dates often. Hard to figure out when assignments are due/what work for the week. She is flexible with extensions. EXTREMELY lectured based. To succeed on exams, pay attention & take notes word for word of what she says.

She's one of the nicest people on earth and really cares about her students. However, she is also kind of a mess of a professor. She clearly is very busy but she wasn't great with technology or planning, so the syllabus was worthless and class got cancelled a lot. Not a hard class and was sometimes very interesting. Put in some work, you'll be fine

Prof Watson is very knowledge of welfare state politics and you would learn a lot about different welfare systems from this class. Lots of readings but manageable and she's really caring and flexible with extensions on assignments. 3 exams each worth 25% and ~15 carmen quizzes make up the rest 25%. Not a hard course but you need to put in the work.

Dr. Watson is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. She was very effective at teaching about the welfare state from a global standpoint and gave me a much deeper understanding of the welfare state here in the US, which is something I believe we all need to understand. This is one of my only classes where I genuinely enjoyed the reading.
The class isn't difficult but Prof Watson was inconsistent and unfair in her grading.

Prof Watson is very kind and approachable. The class itself was not difficult and fairly interesting. However, it was pretty unorganized and did not stick to the syllabus whatsover. Quizzes are easy and open book and she gives you plenty of time to complete them. Exams are also lecture based and nothing out of the blue.

Professor Watson is so clearly passionate about the topic she's teaching and it comes across during lecture. Attendance at lecture wasn't mandatory but doing the readings and going to lecture made it really easy for me come exam time. Prof Watson was very accommodating when I needed it and overall a great teacher.

She was okay. 2 midterm exams (worth 60% total 30% for each. But if you do bad on the 1st exam she will let you change the weight to 20%  40%) attendance is a part of grade and there is no final exam,there is a debate. but you get to sign up to be either a debater(no paper), brief writer (7 page paper), or judge (7 page paper). Easy class.

She gets really excited when she talks, she is great about engaging students and having discussions while staying on topic, even with 60 students. She moved back due dates a lot, which was helpful. It was great that she let us choose whether we wanted to take an exam or write a paper. We could get away with not doing all the readings.

Dr. Watson is a great professor that truly cares about students and enjoys teaching. She is highly knowledgeable and passionate about the material. She made lectures and discussion interesting and fun. This is the second course I have taken with her and I learned a great deal in both. I highly recommend taking a course with her you won't regret it!
She is a very easy grader, if you come to the lectures you don't really need to do the readings. She friendly and enthusiastic, defiantly an expert in her field. I would take her again.
Professor is good. A is easy. And she is always there to ask your questions. But she has awful lectures . They're not coherent at all.

One of the best professor's I have encountered at OSU! She knows what she is talking about and the class is very interesting. I learned a great deal from her. She is also very helpful in office hours, cares about students, and wants you to do well. if you come to class, take notes, and read the course material there is no reason you can't succeed.

This professor and course were great! A fair amount of reading not to much. I didnt have to purchase a text book. The professor was very knowledgable about the course and she was very helpful during office hours. there were two midterms and a debate no final. she gave study guides for both midterms. the class was an eye opener.

Really great class, i took Welfare because i couldn't fit the class i really wanted in there but i am truly glad i took this class!  VERY eye opening class!  Sara Watson is a very great teacher who knows everything about welfare and politics in Europe.  I highly encourage this class and I highly encourage taking this teacher. 2 midterms and debate

If you are white, male, conservative and rich do not take this class. Prof. Watson is very nice, but has one of the most warped ideas of how the Welfare State should be run. She constantly would slam Republicans and men for the problems in society. I walked out several times from outrage over her style of teaching.

Professor Watson has been one of my favorite professors while I have been at OSU. I took this PS class for my major but ended up really enjoying it. She doesn't take attendance, but because few people came the day before Thanksgiving, she took attendance that day and gave us extra credit. I would recommend this professor to a friend.

She is very interested in making sure the students understand the topics and how they react to the studies. She is objective yet structured in her teachings. Class was fun and stimulating. I would recommend this class and teacher to a friend.

I think he has something going on in his personal life that makes him so insufferable. He gives off a general energy of hatred to his students, the world, and himself. He gets joy out of having others misery. How could a small man be so filled with evil? The best part of class was when the bells would ring and he would just lose his mind
Good luck getting a 93 or above in this class. Greg is a nice guy but it's like he makes it a point to grade as difficult as possible. On the plus side, he's very willing to help if you ask for it.
Smith is ok. A bit overrated by some. Discussion is ok when he steps back and lets others speak. Hes new so he will get better

Greg knows the subject area well and provides a fun format for interaction. Easily the most enjoyable political science class Ive had in the last year. He is hilarious and cares about his students. Grading is well structured and he teaches in a way that isnt out to cause anyone unnecessary pain. Greg is a good guy and a great Professor.

I took 2300 and then 3310 and I would recommend this for ANYONE: easy GPA boost, gen ed, last semester of college, somewhat entertaining (he is and the class is if people participate), sometimes he lets out early or cancels which is nice. Content is thought provoking or promotes discussion at least.

Knows the subject well, is available, and caring. Is a tough grader in the sense that he has a clear grading criteria that was hard to grasp for many students. To get an A, read, participate, and be polite (is understanding in future circumstances that you might not plan for but don't take advantage). Do assignments! Everything goes towards grade.

Read from speaker notes the whole time. Had to curve tests by 18 points because people did so badly. Did not give us access to speaker notes so it was extremely hard to keep up and when you would ask to see them he refused. Genuinely I think he is a good guy but not a good teacher.

This class was definitely my least favorite I've taken at OSU. The way it was taught was just so bad. He read very quickly off of a transcript and did not let us see the transcript until after we essentially begged for it. We were constantly behind and had to miss material or cram in order to get everything done before our midterm.

This teacher is not quite a professor here, but solidly shouldn't be. His reading quizzes are hard even if you read the night before and he reads off a transcript. The transcript is NOT released so good luck keeping up with notes. The midterm and final were curved by a lot of points as they too were extremely hard. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!

Dr. Neblo is one of the kindest people I have ever met. Genuinely. It was the first time this course had been taught so it was a little disorganized but it was an honestly inspirational class. His lectures are phenomenal and his knowledge of the political process and democracy as a whole is amazing. A true genius and a thrill to learn from. 100/10.

This class was way too hard for a 2000 level. The lecture videos were only 10 ish minutes and didnt really help me understand anything. Quizzes were really difficult and I went over material multiple times. He didnt give me any feedback on my essays and gave me a really low grade, so I didnt have any way to improve for the final.

His online lectures are amazing & a lot of his quiz questions are phrased word for word on what he said in lecture. Ive never read any of the readings and Ive done fine on his quizzes. His midterm takes a lot of questions from the quizzes so WRITE THEM DOWN. If you do the lectures and take good notes (write exactly what he says) then youre good

Professor Neblo is a really good professor! He always emails back fast, and is very kind when emailing back. His exams are based on in depth responses which the readings are critical to getting a good grade! The quizzes are fair.

He genuinely wants students to do well, and his class is not impossible. That being said, the quizzes are rather difficult for a 2000 level class. The material isn't bad and he does provide guidance for the midterm and final, but still is a rather tough grader. Not a bad class, but certainly not an easy A.

The course consists of a heavy workload of readings! A lot of weekly readings; but it is absolutely possible to get through the class only listening to his lectures. Quizzes are very specific and can be considered hard and tough. Detailed grading for essays. No homework. I do have to say that the curve for this class is amazing though.
Such a stupid class. His videos are way too long. Time for quizzes are way too short. You will struggle. I find it hard to believe that a student wrote the good reviews on this site.

No book for the class, he posts the necessary readings on Carmen. However, it is possible to go the whole course without reading and still get an A. Focus on his lectures and you'll be fine. Take notes, it makes the midterm and final way easier. Overall, good prof, not too hard, just pay attention and you'll be fine!

For the online course he posts lectures online that go over and explain the readings. There are quite a few readings but weekly quizzes but they are not too difficult as long as you read. He gives you the essays for the exams before hand so its really up to you to just prepare well for them. Seems like an intelligent man.

This class is awful. Very difficult for a 2000 level class. Don't take this unless you want a headache. I'll admit I don't have much competency for theory based classes, but the material is boring and SO abstract. The final is also 45% of the overall grade and cumulative. Maybe take this course in person instead of online.

Professor Neblo is a good professor and makes otherwise bland topics interesting. With that said, he does not necessarily make it easy to do well. I did all the readings, watched the lectures, and took notes, and the quizzes were still very difficult. He does provide opportunities for extra credit though.

Prof Neblo is a lighthearted, happy guy. He is a brilliant man and genuinely interested in his work. He is always glad to help students and is very approachable. He explains topics pretty well. The readings are tough but his lectures are where you learn the most. Pop quizzes were pretty hard, and the partial open note tests were decently hard

Professor Neblo was amazing. He genuinely cared about the subject and was able to pass that on to his students. There was a lot of reading to keep up with, but the readings were interesting. Neblo would go on tangents, but they were always relevant to the readings and helped to expand our understanding of them.

Easily the best professor I've ever had. Nice, incredibly intelligent professor who genuinely cares about his students and wants them to learn and succeed. Be aware that it is a political Theory course, so it's going to be rooted in the readings, and the readings won't be as easy as textbook readings.
Goes off on tangents, class has a ton of reading and most of the time you don't get the main points because he doesn't explain things well.  Very smart guy, who is not that great of a teacher

He is one of the most likable, intelligent, and knowledgeable professors that I have had.  Take his class, go to his office hours, put a lot of work into your paper, and you will get a lot out of the class.  The quizzes will screw you because they're impossible, but do well on the paper and you'll do well in the class.

Interesting and engaged.  Always willing to help.  I took this class in the spring of 2004, but actually signed on just to make sure his rating was as high as he deserved.  Great professor...Great person.

Neblo was a terrific professor. He explained concepts very clearly and in-depth. I learned a lot from this course and found it to be very intellectually stimulating--so much that I chose to be a political theory minor. The discussions were good and the midterms were very fair. The quizzes were a bit challenging, but if you study, you will be fine.

He was helpful if you went to office hours. There was no book required for the class. The exams were partially open note. Almost every class, he does not tell you what he wants you to know. He just lets the conversation go where it may. Some of the really difficult readings you may not pick up on the main points unless he gives you a pop quiz.

Professor Neblo is obviously passionate about his field and is eager to express his passion to students.  Sometimes forgets that students don't know his books as well as he does, but offers opportunities for comments and suggestions which is awesome.  If you like a little philosophy and literature in your poli sci take this class :)
I thought they were unresponsive and dismissive. I also felt like they were not particularly knowledgeable. I would not take again.

The professor is very clear on what he wants from you. The quizzes unlock on Sunday and you have all week to do it. I enjoyed listening to his lectures as I found that none of the time was filler or wasted.

Module opens on Saturday and gives you till Friday to take quiz on lecture material. Lectures are kept short and the material is easy. Also has quizzes in the ebook (which are easy but take time) and a couple exams (set up similarly to quizzes). Like it because there isnt a ton of busy work and the lectures arent as boring as I expected.

Professer Gomaz's online classroom was set up in such a confusing and messed up way. Due to this work was never graded in a timely manner nor was the times that things were due consistent. I had to email them multiple time for missing due dates on assignments and about the wrong time things were due. I will never take another class by her

One of the most challenging and frustrating classes I've ever taken at OSU. Gomez uses unclear grading criteria and extremely subjective grading criteria when grading tests and essays. Essays prompts lack description and essays are expected to be extremely long. Not an easy A - beware.
I thought he was rude and condescending. I didn't think he was particularly knowledgeable. I would not recommend taking his course.

Took this class as an asynchronous online class but still got to see how amazing of a professor Chase was. He is a grad student but still explained everything we needed to know for the exams and quizzes very clearly. READ THE BOOK! Two extra credit opportunities and quizzes each week. Gives extra readings to better understand covered material.

Professor Smith was not at all engaging, but his course was intense and fast-paced. It was easy to get lost during lecture. You are required to take a reading quiz on TopHat for attendance at the beginning of every class, your midterm/final are also on there. I don't recommend this course, as his grading and rubrics were vague and not constructive.
Good lectures but discontinuous in the broader picture. Graded by few assignments--final didn't have rubric. Expect to read 40-60 pages a week.

Excessive use of tophat to the point where I would have nightmares. Attendance is mandatory... and so are the dreadful reading quizzes assigned every class. In the nicest way possible, this professor has the charisma of a rotted grapefruit. I struggled to keep my eyelids open. The lectures are NOT engaging. Avoid this class if possible.

Interesting subject but every class was simply spent listening to Professor Smith talk at us and read off the slides which got tedious and boring. Assignments consisted of weekly reading quizzes, a midterm, and a final report worth 45% of our grade. Avoid Professor Smith if you like more active, engaging lectures.

I learned so much from this class. The class seems intimidating at first but you realize it's not that bad. Skim the readings for the reading quizzes. Take notes from the lectures for the exams. The minipapers were annoying but they weren't that bad. It makes no sense getting anything below an A. The easiest 4000 level class I've ever taken.
Such an easy class. Do the readings that are relevant to mini-papers, you can probably skim the rest. Take exact notes on the online lectures. I guarantee you will get an A.

2 reading quizzes and 2 recorded lectures a week with biweekly papers that are easy. Lectures are interesting. If u want an A on the exams / in the class u will need to watch the lectures and take intricate notes. The material is comparative and u will learn a lot that u can use in other classes. Easy A 4000-level course if u watch the lectures.

Typically has two lectures a week with two quizzes about the readings. Skim readings for quizzes. Lectures can be long but they are easy to understand. 6 Mini Papers throughout the semester. Very easy as long as you follow the criteria he gives. 3 exams throughout semester. Not hard as long as you have watched all the lectures.

Two lectures each week that are a bit monotonous but full of information. Most readings are long but the answers to the quizzes are easy to find if you skimmed the text beforehand. Mini-papers every two weeks are very easy as long as you took good notes. Tests are a bit tricky but take good notes on lectures and you will do great.

Honestly just a lot of busy work with quizzes and two lectures a week. He wasn't great, the lectures were just superrr boring. Not a difficult GE if you need to take one. He did genuinely want to teach but everything was so dry. The mini-papers were annoying and quizzes were sometimes confusing. Just watch the lectures and you'll be fine for exams.
This class is a lot of work but it is rewarding. Pay attention to the lectures and skim the readings for the weekly reading quizzes. Great class and a fantastic professor!

Very understanding, quick to answer emails. Exams were open note. Lectures were sometimes hard to understand but if you watch them and take notes class is a breeze. Weekly 5 question quizzes make up most of the grade but you have plenty of time to find the answer. A lot of work sometimes for a GE but really wasn't that bad.

Took this course for a GE my senior year, a lot more work than anticipated. The exams are hard. A lot of questions on the exams are hard to answer even if you utilize the lectures. Your grade is determined by your exam scores (worth over 50%). Not the best option if you have a pretty dense schedule to begin with.

Pretty straightforward material, online lectures and textbook reading are a must. The quizzes are super easy, the questions can all be found on google, but the exams go by quick and you need to get pretty much everything right for a good grade because there are so few. 4 papers too, but graded pretty easy in my opinion. Def recommend!

Taking Intro to Western European History at OSU and enjoyed his class. Very informative lectures (surprises you with the occasional interspersed but well-timed humour) with very interesting material pertinent to most cross-disciplinary areas of study. You will definitely learn from his courses

Dr. Rehm covrA LOT of material: parties, the EU, voter turnout, suffrage, history of democracy, and lots more. But it was fun, not intimidating. There was a fair amount of reading  2 modules per week, each with 1 lecture and 2-3 readings, plus a quiz; some weeks, we also had a mini-essay. But it was 100% manageable, and Dr. Rehm was always nice.

Professor Rehm did a good job with this class. He laid out clear expectations and the assignments were pretty consistent throughout the semester. He gave good feedback on the mini-papers and is usually quick to post information.

This class is SUPER organized and Professor Rehm makes his expectations very clear. There are 2 reading quizzes every week (the answers come straight from the readings he posts on Carmen). No textbook required! 6 small mini papers (300-400 words) and 3 exams. Material wasn't SUPER interesting but Philipp taught it well. Pretty easy if you just try.

Rehm's online class is well-organized and a fair amount of work. I've taken online classes with more and less work in the past, but he is invested and paying attention to the class performance. He allowed a re-take for one of the exams because he wasn't happy with the curve -- he is nice! I would recommend this class, but it'll take time for an A.

Prof. Rehm does an excellent job of instructing this course. His lecture videos are well structured and understandable. As someone who's taken several online courses, they're well above average, even funny at times. Most importantly, every aspect of his course is conducive to learning -- less memorizing, more understanding... Do the work & do well

Exams were focused on very specific topics, must take good notes on lecture videos and scholarly journals to do well. 6 mini-papers throughout the semester, short and simple. Weekly reading quizzes that were relatively easy as long as you did the readings. Was not expecting to put as much time into this class as I ended up doing.

Good online course. Nothing out of the ordinary for a political science course. Weekly quizzes on scholarly articles (could be long at times), mini-papers (300-400 words), and exams (not too bad, just watch his lectures). Takes time to do the work, but if you do it then it's no problem.

Professor Rehm is one of the best professors that I've had so far. His lectures are clear and organized, his reading assignments give you the knowledge you need to do well in the class, and he is helpful. The exams are unforgiving, but you can make up for it with the papers and by attending class. I heavily recommend him.

the class consisted of  only had 4 tests each 25 pts so one bad grade could make or break your grade.  I had to meet with him numerous times but bc he knew me the most out of everyone in the class, he was extra nice to me and helped clarify things even more on the exams. Was a super nice guy. go to class! gave those who went some of the q's & ans

Unwilling to work with a graduating senior who got mono and missed a decent amount of class, but still took the tests. Then missed a test due to my brother being in a life-threatening car accident. Wouldn't even consider giving me an I. Said I "stopped showing up to class" despite having Dr's excuses. Very disappointing. He seemed nice at first.
I feel like I took a different class, from a different instructor. Was reaaaally boring and bland. Quite disappointing. Ugh.

Professor Rehm is a great guy who is extremely understanding and compassionate about his students. However, his teaching style is rather bland and class isn't always easy to sit through. Tests are extremely fair though, and a study guide is given out before every exam. The class is very easy if you put in the time and do the work.

I'm obsessed with Professor Rehm! He is the best professor I've had at OSU so far, and I'm a third year. The work was very balanced and not overwhelming. He provides helpful study guides and give you plenty of opportunity for points. He's very intelligent and understanding. Take his class!

His exams are unforgiving and test the material taught in a seemingly arbitrary fashion, with an illogical distribution of points awarded for correct answers on subjects that were not emphasized in the lecture or the readings. He seems to get off on the fact that his style of teaching makes it difficult for some students.
Rehm is the best professor I've had at OSU. Sweet guy that cares about students and has a genuine interest in teaching.

You will learn a lot about political systems in this course. It's a decent amount of work, but well worth it if you're a political science major. Professor Rehm is incredibly intelligent and an overall good professor.

Professor Rehm was very helpful, and I enjoyed the class a lot.  Tons of reading and basically everything is a powerpoint, but he really does try to engage the students.  I would recommend the class to anyone in the major or outside it that doesn't mind reading 100-150 pages a week.

Be prepared to do a lot of reading, and you have to go to every class. He is a stickler on attendance. He has random pop quizzes and short 1-page papers every other week. However, you will learn so much from this professor and class. He really does a great job organizing the course. If you do the work, you'll get a good grade.
Really nice guy who makes the classes interesting. Good amount of reading but if you do it, you'll do well in the class. I'd recommend him to any major.

Fantastic professor. Very liberal, but encourages you to think for yourself. Decent amount of reading. 2 tests and 4 short (300 word) writing assignments. Extremely knowledgeable/intelligent, one of the best professors I've had. Highly recommended
Take this class immediately if you are looking for easy GE. You do not have to study for a thing and literally can get an A by spending 15 min a week on it (taking the quiz). Its all online.
One of the easiest online classes ive taken. Every week there are two assignments, and as long as you follow the guides she gives you, youll be fine. Easy A

There's  weekly quizzes & assignments which were straight from the power points.  There was also extra credit every week which doesn't take long and I would absolutely recommend.  Make sure to keep all the due dates straight for midterms because you have one window to take it and if you forget you can't retake it.  Never used textbook.

You don't need to read the book.  This is a common sense political science class, plus all the quizzes are on quizlet word for word.  Exams are just same questions from quizzes.  Extra credit is handed out for doing little pointless participation assignments.

Weekly quizzes and participation, extra credit offered every week, two midterms and a final. Able to search -find answers in the power points so I never really actually listened to lectures. Quizlet is a good help. Get a decent grade on your quizzes, do the participation and extra credit every week and it should be an easy A.
the comment from 4/27/2015 is 100% correct. if you do well on the quizzes and by well i mean above (75%) and do all the participation quizzes you should be able to get an A.

Dr. Brooks is amazingly accomplished and a great lecturer. She really knows her material; her powerpoints and lectures make the material very clear especially for tests and papers. The class is easy if you go and pay attention.
Really really cool person. She's a full bright scholar and has been around the world so she really knows her stuff.
online is easy just command find through powerpoints mostly

Professor Brooks is an absentee-online professor that does research abroad while facilitating the course. You will never see her, or anyone for that matter in the course. Content is straightforward. Readings are unnecessary, just skim through her powerpoints and you will be fine. Take advantage of the extra credit on weekly quizzes; it will add up!

Professor Brooks is an excellent teacher and I learned so much from her class. There are 2 midterms and a final paper. The course is somewhat difficult but she is very helpful through email and office hours. She also  offers a lot of extra credit so there is no reason you can't get an A.  Lectures were  more enjoyable because she is hilarious!
She is one my my least favorite teachers I have probably had. Her attitude is always negative and is not helpful at all.

She really is not helpful at all, and is not clear with grades in class since she barely posts them online and you have to keep emailing her in order to see what you have in the class. She grades though and is not understanding. Would not take a course with her again.

Dr. Brooks is a really cool online professor. Take this class with her, it is one of the most fun online classes I have ever taken. All her tests are multiple choice and she offers a lot of extra credit.The textbook is also fairly easy to read.  She is highly organized and you learn a great deal  but also get to enjoy the class!
Professor Brooks is extremely intelligent and very knowledgable about her field. If you attend lecture and do the required readings this class is a cakewalk. It doesn't hurt that she's good looking.

Professor Brooks is extremely nice and knows what she is talking about. Her class focuses on democracy and she does a great job teaching it. I don't think its necessary to read the textbook if you take god notes but MAKE SURE TO DO THE READINGS. There are a few quizzes, decently hard midterm essay, and a take home final.

Political science was not as interesting as I thought. Midterm and finally are choosing two of four essay questions. I felt stupid in that class because we moved from one discussion topic to another so fast that I couldn't contribute let alone wrap my head around what we were talking about.

Class was a little dry sometimes, but the overall topics were usually pretty interesting.  An essay midterm and two take-home essays and thats it.  Not too tough.  Pay attention, do the readings, and you'll get an A.

This is the most boring class EVER. Her TA grades all of the tests, essays and grades very strictly, almost unfair. I would avoid 597 with her if you could, I thought I nailed my midterm and ended up with a C because the TA wants to grade extra hard...Lame

Prof Brooks is extremely knowledgeable. She knows Brazil in and out. As far as her class is concerned, she allowed us to have open book essay midterms. It doesn't get any easier than that. One one midterm, I forgot my notes at home and still got an A. I got an A in the class although I think she curved it. Overall, great teacher!
nice lady but hard to understand not very clear when it comes to handouts and overheads

At first I thought this class would be a bust: She came in with overheads and lectured somewhat dryly for an hour. But as the sessions went on I found I actually learned quite a lot about the complex world of global economy and she actually made it pretty interesting with wit and humor. She's very friendly,  and the tests weren't bad.
Great teacher, Extremely intelligent.

Real world experience.  She knew her stuff and would have reason to be arrogant and condescending- but never was.  Willing to help and seemed to have a vested interest in our understanding.  Lectures were dry, as expected, but group discussion made up for that.  Assignments were essays. She posted readings online since packet was expensive.
Great professor, really went out of her way to help students if they asked for it.
Good class, sometimes a little dry, but I feel like I learned a lot about economics. Good personality.
I thoroughly enjoyed this class; I reccomend that all Poli sci majors take her class to learn more about the growing field of political economy. Her TA was wonderful as well.
She's awful.  Arrogant and not helpful.  Avoid at all costs!
Class is what you what you make of it.  It's a little difficult at first if you don't know anything about political economy, but Brooks knows her stuff and is always willing to answer questions.
One of the worst instructors I've had as OSU.  In a department with so many wonderful professors, her class was very disappointing.  I'd advise anyone against taking her courses.
Super nice woman but her leactures were very boring. I never went and got an A- in the class.

Good professor although the material can be confusing to those who don't have a background in econ.  First exam was hard, but they get easier and there's extra credit.  She is always willing to help if you are confused on something.
She seems shy, but she present the material clearly in a way that makes sense.  Plus she's cute.
No Comments
Learned and Hot.  What a combination.
smart, interesting, learned much,and a total hottie

Attendance is absolutely mandatory with no excuses whatsoever. I approached her about a mental health crisis I was going through which caused me to fall behind in the class and she did not allow me to make up any points at all nor did she even bother responding to my follow up emails. Not disability friendly, mental/physical illness friendly, etc.

Very unengaging class where you just read about academic studies on income inequality. Rarely discuss its actual effects in real life or any real discussion. Due dates occasionally changed too. Lots of talk about the methodology on the studies as well. Very accessible outside class however. Would not reccomend

Participation in discussion is very engaging and nessecary part of the class. Whitsett is more than happy to challenge you and prod discussion along, will always try to show the theories in class the best light. Only 3 papers and pop quizzes, papers can be difficult however. Lots of readings as well but makes sure you can understand. Would recc!

Honestly felt discriminated against for my particular political views. Caters to democratic leaning students. Landed me a B+ for not speaking enough. He needs to reevaluate his class lectures and not lean towards one sided-ness. Absolutely DO NOT recommend.

He is established in his field, has a sense of humor, and cares for his students. However, this doesn't make him a good teacher. Lectures were disorganized, the syllabus was completely different from the actual course, he was unreachable outside of class, and the second half of the semester was just watching him code. Not a hard A, but not good.
He is my dad I love him

Mr. Trende was a very nice guy. His class was lecture heavy but he made it interesting by relating to us and making jokes. The one issue I had with him was I could rarely reach him outside of class. Also all of his assignments had barely any explanation and he would add additional topics we had to cover that we not written in the assignment rubric.
I had to travel a lot for athletics and would need to makeup exams/papers. Professor failed to email me back until THE DAY OF the exam. Very inconsistent and confusing.

Sean Trende is one of the best teachers/professors I have ever had. He makes class interesting and he really cares about his students. I think I laughed out loud during almost every single lecture I was in. He knows his students are human. There are a good amount of quizzes but if you study you will do well.

I really enjoyed this class. Prof Trende is really passionate about what he does and teaches and it shows. The class was weighted like 60% attendance and 40% quizzes and then a midterm and a final. If you show up, pay attention, and then study a little for weekly quizzes you'll do fine.

Overall I really enjoyed this class. The midterm and final were challenging but not hard to do well on with a little effort. He is very knowledgable and wants you to get a good grade too. I learned a lot from Sean!

Prof Trendes class was very enjoyable and easy. He is friendly and utilizes current events during lecture. Hes accessible outside of class and really tries to get to know his students. He has written me n others letters of rec, and he still remembers me and my classmates from years ago. Class gives good understanding of American politics.

Lecture cover a lot of material and you never know what could be on the weekly quizzes. Quiz questions are often framed for more than one answer to be correct but if you dont pick the specific one he wants you dont get credit.
Sean is by far one of my favorite professors. Wants his students to succeed. Only 6 quizzes a midterm and a final. Reuses the quiz questions on midterm and final. Sometimes lectures can be boring.

Sean is my favorite professor. He makes the material make a lot of sense through funny analogies, keeping the class light but thorough. I have gotten to know him really well because he is so accessible and it is clear that he really wants his students to succeed.

Is basically a famous political scientist. He makes this class exciting just by the way he brings the content to life. One of the most interesting people Ive ever met. 10/10 would recommend. Doesnt believe in homework and just wants you to understand the material.

Solid instructor who I feel like will get better over time. The lectures were very thorough and well-planned out which was good. I found the exams easy, but they weren't for some, you kind of have to say exactly what she wants you to say to get the points. The readings weren't that necessary but helped a lot if you want to truly learn the material.

Her class is not really an easy GE. I did find the class boring and the exams hard but that is also because I don't have a high interest in these topics. She is a picky grader for sure so if you want an easy easy GE I would take it with someone else!

Professor Ku is very thorough in her lectures and provides you with great notes and information. She gives you 9 terms in advance which you must be able to define and explain in terms of international relations. Ton exam day you are given 3/9 terms to write about. Its a nice way to show your knowledge, but make sure you follow the rubric!

Took this class over Summer semester and I loved it! I ended with a B because tests and quizzes are weighted heavy and I truly did the best I could! Professor explained guidelines and I did not have to reach out about anything throughout the semester. He is very friendly and always reminded us of due dates and that he was available.

This was a very easy class, and I am not good at Poly Sci. You do inquisitives every couple of weeks, and there are quizzes that go along with it that are easy and only 10 questions. He has discussion posts for extra credit you can do, and theres 1 midterm, 1 final, and a research paper, not hard. Just pay attention with the inquisitives

The class was super easy to pass and understand. Quizzes due every week about lectures posted online as well as topics covered in textbook. Midterm & final fairly easy. Professor Goldman was very understanding during COVID-19 and made adjustments for students struggling. Recommend 100% if you need to take polisci
Moshe is a great instructor! Very understanding and clear about expectations.

I took this class as a 6 week course, and the amount of reading required was the worst part. Tests and quizzes are not easy, but doable. The paper wasn't bad, but he is a tough grader--very specific requirements that aren't stated very clearly. He definitely cares about teaching and tries to help students learn.

The course was super interesting. There was a ton of reading and the tests and quizzes were very hard. Professor Clarke was very nice to work with though and was super responsive. Paper was very easy.

Professor Clarke genuinely cares about his students and is very open to answering questions and feedback. I took his class as an 8 week course so it moved fast. If you do the readings and pay attention, youll be fine. He makes himself accesible and if honestly people who had issues just didnt want to put in work.

By far my favorite class and favorite professor at OSU. Lectures were super interesting and well presented, but moved quickly so be ready to take efficient notes. He always stopped to clarify things or answer questions, though. The readings could be pretty long, but for the most part you could get away with skimming the intro and results sections.

John is easily one of the best instructors I've had. Easy-going, funny, & can keep my attention (not an easy task to accomplish) via teaching methods. I can tell John loves what he does & truly wants us to understand. Puts lots of effort into lectures. Liked the grading system: start at zero, work up; it's motivation to pay attention & do well.

If you have the chance take a class with John. He is absolutely phenomenal. His knowledge of the field and literature amazed me but it showed through his lectures where you knew he was teaching for you to understand even though hes mastered it. You will have to go to class because nothing is online, but he makes it a great time! 100% recommend!

Professor Harden LITERALLY changed my freshman year at OSU to the better!!! I was going into second semester thinking either OSU professors are anything but helpful or the COVID thing really took the OSU community spirit away. Well, he proved me wrong! Honestly, just show up in class, ask questions if you don't understand, study, and you are fine!

Funny , empathetic , and smart! Made class during COVID less weird and awkward and now I want to learn about "IR". He makes you work but he is always helpful I realized over break I wanted to be back in class which is NOT like me. One of my favorites I WISH HE HAD MORE CLASSES!
Professor Harden's class is fun! Great material once you get past foundational stuff. He does cool stuff with the class personality survey Highly recommend!
Johns classes have been my favorite so far. Hes always available and willing to help whenever needed. Very clear assignment expectations and interesting/funny lectures!
I took John's class in the Fall. John is really intelligent funny and cares about teaching. Not as easy as he says but thats ok because I learned a lot and lecture was actually engaging!

John is clearly a professor that cares about making sure you pass his class. While he has a no laptops policy, I never found it to be a hinderance. In fact, it allowed me to pay more attention to the lecture. The subject matter of the class can be dry at times, but John is absolutely hilarious, and makes the material enjoyable.
Not a lot of work and no laptops allowed. Class is dry.

John is the best professor I have had at OSU. He's absolutely hilarious and interesting. This class should be renamed Leadership Psych because that's really what it is. Take notes in class, but he gives you the answers to the quizzes the day before you take it. About 6 7-question section "exams" and final. SUPER manageable and lots of extra credit

This was one of my favorite class I've taken across the board. John is so down to earth and relatable but is also insanely smart and able to answer all questions and explain things in a way that makes sense. Im the type of person that gets bored in lectures and that's happened maybe once, he's so engaging and entertaining with great lecture content

John was my favorite teacher in the Poli Sci department! He wants you to get an A and makes it as easy as possible, but he's not a pushover, so you still need to work for it. His class is a pretty casual environment, his lectures are pretty straightforward, and he's just a genuinely funny person! Not gonna lie...I'm kinda jealous of his boyfriend.

I'm torn about John. He loves teaching and that shows. However, he never made powerpoints which was difficult for me as I am a very visual learner rather than auditory. The class was easy, about 40% of the grade was given to you for free essentially. I like him as a person though and would take a class with him again.
Great Professor.

John is an incredible professor & person. He is so caring and sincerely loves teaching and making relationships with his students. He's very real and recognizes the struggle of college and balancing classes and makes his coursework practical. He goes above and beyond to make sure everyone benefits from his class. He genuinely wants you to succeed.
John was a wonderful professor. Always very flexible and respectful of students' needs. The class was engaging and as long as you do the work and put in effort, you will get an A!

My favorite class this semester! Johns section of AFP is incredibly practical for poli sci students and nonmajors alike. He ensures that no ones questions go unanswered, regardless of how trivial they may be. He is very straightforward on assignment expectations and is always available to help with course material inside and outside of class.

John was a really good instructor. He kept class casual enough that students felt comfortable contributing anything and anything to discussion. He is really funny and engaging and definitely cares about his students. We had some great discussions. Despite his easy demeanor and casual class environment he is still respected. 10/10

John was a great instructor for this course. He fostered a genuine interest in his student and prompted great discussions amongst students in his class. He is engaging and funny. Overall, I loved the class.

Graded on 3 papers- follow directions he gives you on them and its easy. The last one ended up being extra credit! Then short online quizzes due every class. Easy! Tries to make class interesting and stimulating even though political science/foreign policy isnt my major, I still found it interesting. Very funny and nice.

John Harden excels in his teaching style, which, compared to other instructors, is both unique and highly engaging. He is succinct and very transparent about the pertinent details one would need in order to succeed in his course. With that, he is very approachable outside of class and emits a genuine attitude of respect toward his students.

Professor John Hardens professional conduct is second only to his mastery of the material in which he teaches. Truly an inspiration to the education system, Professor Harden is dedicated to a life of service in promoting a genuine interest among his students in the field of American Foreign Policy.

Very good lectures that are interesting and the info is mostly easy to follow and useful. Hes very funny and the class stays engaged. The feedback he gives on papers is very useful and the grading criteria is very clear.

John is a great instructor. He tells you what you need to do in order to get the best grade possible in class. Show up, take notes, read the abstracts, and get an A! Honestly, I feel like I learned more in this class than most!

Super interesting class and John did a good job teaching it. He's a grad student so he was very casual, I found that nice. Also, he has a dog wanted to bring to class but couldn't because a person or two weren't ok with it. Who doesn't like dogs?? I was so disappointed by that but hopefully he'll be able to in future classes and others can enjoy!

Hes a really great professor. Actually one of the best professors Ive had and that is taking in consideration both he professors I have experienced from the university of Toledo and here at Ohio state.
Attendance was mandatory for our class. It was worth it.
John is an excellent lecturer and designs his classes for you to pass, with some effort.

John is a great instructor. He uses personal examples to help solidify the material and is easy going. He can go off topic sometimes, but overall a great instructor. He's really funny and wants everyone to do well in class.

For 2400, he warned us that we would have to read a lot. If you attend the lectures, this isn't true. If you go to class and take notes during lectures, there's no reason you shouldn't get an A. He lets you participate in class as much or as little as you want, and is a very light grader on exams.
Grant Sharratt is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State so far. The readings can be dense, but he does an amazing job breaking them down in lectures.

I loved this class! The class format is a discussion, but if you don't understand that reading for one class don't worry he explains each topic so well! Take really good notes because it helps alot for the exams and final bonus paper. This was my favorite class that I have taken at OSU. He makes class so enjoyable, one weekly quiz and two exams!

Great professor! He is really funny and just generally has a chill energy. Despite that, it's obvious that he really knows what he's talking about. I'm not a big fan of political theory, but his class made it really interesting. I would recommend doing the readings so you're able to participate in the lectures, but you don't have to.

The best professor Ive had so far! There are two readings per week. If you dont read them, he explains it well during class. I do advice take notes. Pretty funny and knows what he is doing. Genuinely cares. Take it, you wont regret it!

this professor provides all the readings and there is no cost to you. it is really easy, class is like a discussion everyday. I would take good notes if you don't read each piece. The notes and what is discussed is exactly what is on the exam. Weekly quizzes are easy and if you pay attention and have good notes you'll get a 100% every time
Great experience in his class. His lectures are interesting and it is very easy to get a good grade in his class. Would absolutely take again.

Love his intro to political theory class. Each week we are assigned two authors he reviews them in the lecture and are given and online quiz the next week. They are so easy if you just listen a little during class (I have never read before). He gives you all possible questions for the two exams and you are able to use a cheat sheet. Take it!
He was so interesting and funny.

Dr. Robinson is a great professor. As long as you do the reading and attend lectures, the class is very easy.  She also curves the exams if many students struggle with certain questions and offers extra credit opportunities. If you do the work, it is very easy to get an A. Also, the lectures are info heavy but still interesting.

the exams are terrible. They donot even seem that hard while you are taking them, but she grades like a hound. Average of the first exam was a 68, no curve. She offers little extra credit and the only plus is she drops the lowest 8 quiz grades, but with the exams being worth 70% of ur grade it does not really matter now does it. I would avoid it.

Toughest political science course I have taken at OSU. The course takes a scientific approach to identity and ethnicity which means you are put through a meat grinder of reading material throughout the semester. You will not pass if you are not keeping up with the readings. Everything is fair game on exams. Write everything down!

Dr. Robinson is a tough prof, but if you do the readings then you can do well. While there are a lot, they're very instructive on nat'lism and ethnicity. She's a brilliant scholar, and if you are thinking about research then she's a great person to ask for help. Grading is mostly exams plus reading quizzes. You get out of the class what you put in.

Dr. Robinson is brilliant, but her class is way harder than it has to be. Super difficult reading quizzes, and lots of stuff on tests that were hardly covered. Interesting class, but I definitely would not take it again.

While Amanda clearly knows her material, she is extremely monotone and doesn't get students engaged or involved. The material can seem a little repetitive and it would have gone smoother if the class structure was different.

Dr. Robinson taught such an amazing class. I learned so much and the assignments were sort of fun. We had a presentation and paper and I actually sort of enjoyed those. The exams also weren't bad, they were online and open note. There are small reading quizzes everyday, but if you read they are super easy. Loved this class.

Amanda has a lot of potential to be a good professor. But she is awful. Her class is asinine, the study guides are no help on the tests, and she's boring. Dozens of pages of reading each night. I would not take this class if I were forced to. It's way so hard it's not worth it.
This is the third class I have taken with Dr. Robinson. Although you have to work for an A, her classes will teach you a ton and she is extremely intelligent and well respected in her field.

This was the first time Democratic Erosion was offered at OSU and Prof. Robinson did a great job with it even though it's not her area of expertise. Lots of reading (about 100 pages/wk), but workload is manageable all things considered. Hopefully OSU continues to offer this course and has her teach it at least a couple more times!
Seems to really care about how her teaching is going and how she can improve herself. Reading quizzes for each class, but they are only like two easy questions each.

Dr. Robinson is great! She is extremely passionate and knowledgable about the material being covered. She also gave us a one sided sheet of paper as a cheat sheet for the exams. There is  paper and presentation that take some effort, but its certainly not absurd amount of work. The hardest part of the course was the map quiz on Africa

She is extremely knowledgable and loves what she teaches. Class can get boring at times and she may not be as engaging but she cares about the subject a lot. She is a VERY VERY TOUGH professor in grading exams and constructing them. Be prepared to work hard. I got an A but considering the amount of coursework, the class should have been a 4000.

Robinson is a great teacher. She really wants her students to do well. She makes sure to ask students if her current teaching style is working and reworks the curriculum to help the students learn better. If you pay attention and stay on main points you'll do fine. A good person overall.

One of the best courses I have had here at OSU!  Dr. Robinson is an excellent professor and I would take anything that she taught. The lectures were engaging and fun. Not your average poli sci class, she teaches using a variety of disciplines and challenges you to think for yourself. Very helpful in office hours and gives points back on exams.

Good instructor. She's loves what she teaches and has experience. Very nice approachable and friendly. Gives pop quizzes over readings to do random attendances checks. Tests and lectures are straightforward

Professor Yadon was great for POLISCI 3910. She utilized both lectures and discussions to keep students engaged. She's also extremely caring and wants students to do well. I had many personal issues this semester and she emailed me multiple times trying to make sure I stayed on track. She was very helpful. It's obvious she wants students to do well

He is one of the best professors I've had in a while, as he truly cares about his students' needs and provides beneficial feedback as well! He makes the political theory so much more interesting than what it actually is. The structure of his class is so well-organized, that it is easy to follow along even when the readings are content-heavy.

Donghye Kim is one of the best professors that teaches political theory. I took his class Politics of Freedom online SP2021. The readings were sort of long but incredibly thought-provoking. About 4 response papers and a take-home midterm and final. He really cares about the success of his students! Would take him again if I wasn't graduating.

Fair amount of reading but its discussed in depth in class. Papers about every 2 weeks but theyre not bad if you were in class to discuss the readings theyre on. Hes very friendly and understanding if you need to miss class or get an extension. Would recommend.

Pros: lots of extra credit, exams administered online, straightforward material, open to student feedback and questions, lots of videos and speakers Cons: mandatory attendance and reading quizzes every class, exams are difficult and worded like generic riddles. The class was kind of annoying but would take again

Provided the lecture PPTs beforehand, which is good because she flew through the slides. That being said, she also asked if anyone had any questions before switching topics. Reading quizzes every class. Sometimes brought in outside speakers. Offered 2 opportunities for extra credit (up to 5%). Had a midterm exam, final exam, and final paper.

Everything that the other ratings said. Shes easy to get in contact with outside of class and very understanding. Put as much effort into the 3 short exams as you can because thats the bulk of the points.
Easy class, if you put in the work you will do well. Interesting lectures and readings. Weekly reading quizzes that are pretty easy, she drops the lowest score for those too.

Liwu's class consists of weekly reading quizzes and 3 exams. Her quizzes come straight from the assigned readings, and her exams from her recorded lectures and readings. She also drops the lowest quiz grade which is nice. Just do the work and it's an easy course.

Great instructor. Replied quickly outside of class. Interesting material. Only complaint is that it was a bit of reading some weeks, but as long as you can budget time for it, then PS3440 is a great class with him. Would take another class with him in a heartbeat.
Good Professor, he tells you everything that is on the exams and all answers are in the PowerPoints.

Definitley one of the best classes I have taken at OSU. Professor MacGilvray is very likeable and keeps his lectures engaging. It's easy for me to get bored & distracted in classes but I never was for this one. He also gives constructive feedback on papers and really sets you up to do well on exams.

Don't let the 2xxx level fool you-- this class is tough. You will have to come to class and pay attention to know what's going on. Your grade is 90% exams, but they're fair. If you put the work in, it's not awful. Eric is a really nice guy , engaging in class, and is always willing to help you out if you're lost.

Funniest teacher I've ever had. This class was also very difficult... Based on three written exams. If you tank one, like I did because of a nasty breakup, you can't fully recover from it. Still, his class was ridiculously entertaining, and I learned a lot. I still frequently reference texts I read in this class. Accessible/ helpful outside class.

He is funny and his lectures were pretty entertaining but sometimes no matter how hard I tried I still had trouble understanding what we were talking about. I think political theory might just be a difficult subject in general. I wish he would have been more clear with what we were supposed to take away from each reading.

I have taken two classes with MacGilvray now and he is TOUGH, there is not argument from there, but it is worth it. Even if you do not fully understand the reading, he goes over it in class knowing full well they are confusing af sometimes. Honestly, going to class for his horrific/hilarious board drawings is just worth it in itself.

Professor MacGilvray is not only an amazing professor but also a great human being. His class is very inspiring and very heavily test-based but he does curve the score to your advantage every time. However you dont have to be worried about the tests as long as your pay attention in class, take careful notes and make flash cards for test studies.

ok, so this class all depends on the students that are in it. Ive heard some really cringey comments in this class. since he offers credit for participation youll have a lot of annoying freshmen trying to kiss his ass. grading is very vague. class isnt easy, but the prof is very likable.

Dr. MacGilvray is amazing, but the class is definitely hard. It's totally worth it, but you have to study, and take really detailed notes during class (look out for buzz words!). His class consists of three exams, each worth 30% of your grade, and 5 pop quizzes (lowest one dropped), for the remaining 10%. He's really funny and intelligent.
He is great. You do a lot of reading but then go over it in class. Hes very engaging and does a lot of funny things to keep it interesting. Great guy.

Most engaging and entertaining professor I've ever had. Always willing to answer questions and makes sure students understand the material. The chalk throwing never got old. Not many professors leave a lasting impact on me, but Professor MacGilvray definitely did in such a positive way!
Fantastic!!!!

It's entirely possible to get an A in this class - but it won't come easy. There's lots of reading, and it's important to know how to tie all the concepts together. It's a good class and I've learned a lot, but it requires effort.
Great class! He is very hyper and that makes the material enjoyable to learn.

I'm in my last year, and Dr. MacGilvray has easily been my favorite professor at OSU. He doesn't have powerpoint slides or even any detailed notes. His class is very discussion based and he uses it to explain some very dense readings. it's definitely not an easy class, but it's truly opened my eyes to so much in the field of Political Science.

The first week you may think that since there is no homework, you can skip and pass no problem... you'd be wrong. The detail in the lectures that he provides cannot be made up by attending the review seasons. Theres is no way to fake your way through his tests. Lots of reading required but it becomes easier to understand after discussion.
Throws chalk every time he references something on the board, very funny in lecture, very clear about exams

Pop quizzes over readings.  Only two other grades, a midterm and a final where you just write everything you can possibly remember.  He had no clear criteria for the assessments so you have no idea what he wants or where you went wrong, but did give a study guide, and curved well.  He's an amazing lecturer, though.  Review sessions are a must.

One of the hardest classes i've ever taken. His test format is absolutely brutal and if your mind has a tendency to wander like mine does, its really tough. But if you pay attention to everything he says and do the readings, you'll be okay

Theory can be difficult, this much is true, but sometimes it feels like Prof. MacGilvray makes it as difficult as possible. Class is dragged on by his harsh implementation of the Socratic method, there are no slides/notes so you MUST attend, he gives pop quizzes constantly, and tests are a nightmare. Glad I like this stuff and at least he's nice.
DO NOT TAKE POLITICAL THEORY FROM HIM!!! his test are so abstract and our harvard law graduate/TA struggles to grade and understand him. He's very entertaining but also very insane. good luck

The class is a requirement for both my minors so I had no choice but to take it. Eric is very intelligent but he is so intelligent everything he says is foreign. He grades exams on a curve, 27/50 is a C/C+. He gives you the exam in advance but it only makes it harder. Readings are 20pgs minimum and very dense. Don't take the class unless you have 2

I am an international student at OSU. I took his 4413 before and also this 4411. He Is A Brilliant Prof - thats what I'd say! Knowing basic Greek and Latin are  granting you extra fun thru the readings of Plato and Aquinas. You only gotta know oikos nomos for economy, know the difference between daimon and demon to enjoy his lecture blahblah i

This man is absolutely brilliant. MacGilvray is invested in his students learning something. He is passionate about the material, and it shows. Favorite class and professor. Do not pass up the opportunity to take a class with him.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!! He makes the class interesting with his enthusiasm. Jumps around the class, on the desk and throws chalk!! There is alot of reading required but if you're a polisci major at OSU, it should be normal. Awesome teacher so I am enrolled in 4413 for the next semester.
class was way too difficult and material is very dull... unfortunate that it is a requirement for political science majors
Guys an idiot, thinks hes teaching a class to Harvard students.  Tests are on quotes found thoughout the readings, wanted way more info out of them then they truly convey.
He's really good at conveying concepts and keeping the class interested. Also an extremely nice guy. Highly recommended.

MacGilvry is one of the best proffs I've had. I highly reccomend his class for those who enjoy polical science, though I warn that he is a very tough grader. No reason anyone should not be able to at least get a C in class. Great guy good prof.

Prof. MacGilvray is enthusiastic about the subject and genuinely wants you to understand it and think critically about it.  Tough grader on papers; he will find the loopholes in your logic.  But comprehensive final is doable.  Overall a great class; lectures were v. engaging and sometimes bordered on theatrical.

Eric is a good guy. There are a great deal of readings, but they are not mandatory (do the ones you think are necessary for your paper). The final exam is pretty easy and he gives a comprehensive review sheet.

one of the best classes i've taken at ohio state. he really knows what he's talking about and i regret skipping lecture so often. the final exam was draining and ruined my grade (aside from my flaky attendance-not mandatory). i didn't do much of the reading but i wish i did. i recommend taking any class by macgilvray.
Nice man. Likes the class to discuss in a seminar setting. Makes class think critically. Doesn't give out too many A's, but he's likable.

poly sci 590.04 theories of freedom.  this class was one of the most intellectually stimulating i've ever taken.  reading is a must, and there is a vicious amount of reading.  the paper's arent too bad if you know what you're talking about and can back them up.  the exam was difficult because of the sheer number of concepts to master
good prof, keeps lectures engaging and is very helpful when you ask him questions. you really feel like you learn something each class from this guy.

Professor Chlouba is great. This course definitely contains a lot of heavy material, but he does a great job of going over it in the lectures, and inserting some humor. Just do the readings and quizzes and you should be more than fine.

Really smart dude. Class focuses on Africa which I didn't know much about but the readings were super helpful. 2q reading quiz before each class, a midterm, and a final paper are all the grades, so study hard. Lectures were super interesting and he loved to get people engaged and start conversation without inserting his personal opinion. 10/10

AMAZING professor. Lectures are interesting & easy to follow. A lot of her class is based on Cambodia because that's where she does her research. Extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Let's you retake any assignment/midterm/quiz/paper. The simulation is very fun. No final, just a final paper. She wants you to succeed.

This woman is incredible- I was recommended to take her through my advisor and she is everything I couldve asked for. I mean it when I say she should teach every PoliSci class at OSU. Her lectures are easy to take notes on and she really cares about your education rather than giving you a grade. Take her class!!!

Erin is an absolutely wonderful professor! She is very kind and understanding, giving amazing lectures. The simulation was very fun and was one of my favorite parts of the class. Highly suggest taking any class with Professor Lin!

Erin Lin is by far the best professor. She is so sweet and caring. My course was online (covid). Our midterm was able to be retaken, and the simulation she has us do is so fun and easy points if you are involved and do the work. The final paper is long but she grades easy so I got an A on it. Overall an enjoyable class an a great professor

Professor Lin is one of the most intelligent women I have come across. The class structure is based on simulations from real world conflicts which is unlike any class I have taken before. The papers are extremely manageable and the class set-up is extremely productive, thanks to her organization and experience! Would highly recommend!
Amazing professor. Highly recommend her class. Its easy but you will learn a lot if you show up and pay attention.
Dr. Lin is one of the best professors you will have at OSU. She is intelligent, engaging, understanding, and hilarious. Show up to class, take some notes, and you'll get an A.

She is such a funny, personable, and incredibly intelligent professor. She really engages in conversation with us during lecture, and makes her incredibly difficult, graduate-level readings easy to understand in lecture! Make sure to go to her office hours and get to know her. Her and her TA help so much with papers and tests, so use them!

Dr. Lin is really funny, super smart, and explains hard concepts really clearly. I really loved her class! if you put the work in, you'll get an A, and it's not a ton of work. Readings are all pretty easy, and she goes over them in class, so even if you have trouble, you'll come out understanding it. Tests and quizzes are really fair.

Different style of teaching, mostly lectures but with "simulations" throughout the class. Some are interesting, graded on participation. Just show up and you'll get an A. Readings are extremely long and difficult but we go over them in class so you don't really have to fully understand them. One midterm and one short paper.

I learned a lot from Dr. Lin. She goes over the readings in all of her lectures, so be sure to come to class. While the readings are tough, her explanations are very clear and engaging. Be careful of the exams though, they were actually pretty tough. If the class average is low, she will provide various extra credit opportunities. Great class.

She's awesome. Very clear in explaining the readings in lecture, very good at answering questions. She genuinely cares about the subject material and teaching the course, and the class simulations are a great way to get "hands-on" experience with what she teaches. Definitely going to take a class with her again.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. She teaches you so much and in such an original way with the simulations, and though her midterms can be a bit difficult, she goes out of her way to make sure everyone that works hard ultimately succeeds. I wish I could take all of my classes with her, honestly.

Prof. Lin Is a great professor. She has a vast knowledge that she is willing to share. If you show up to the class the course is very simple. If you skip good luck... There are reading assigned every day that she spends the entire lecture going over. I did not read any of the reading but made sure I went to class every day and did fine.

I really liked the simulations that she would do. Each student would get a different character (randomly selected) and you would try to create the best course for the simulation country. Professor Lin is very smart and participation in class is the best way for a good grade.

She is very good at what she does, not sure how good she is at conveying that information. Slides sometimes rambled about things that weren't relevant to the material at hand, but the tests and quizzes were manageable. Weekly labs weren't graded, but you definitely should do them to practice. Problem sets made up a big chunk of grade and were hard.

Such an amazing, engaging, and easy online course! Professor Trimble has lots of knowledge from his background in international communication and is sure that you can learn something from it. Responds quickly and gives GREAT feedback and conversation-starting points. Truly such a caring man and understanding professor

If you get the chance to take Professor Trimble's international comm class. do it. very nice guy who always keeps his class up to date. you are never going to be caught off guard. responds quickly and if you show up and do your work he will help you in alot of ways. work is constant but not difficult. great teacher

Professor Trimble was my favorite professor at OSU as an undergrad. He was very clear about grading and accessible whenever necessary. The final project of designing a disinformation campaign was hard, but not impossible (and was actually pretty fun). Take his class!

One of the best courses and professors! He has a huge network in the industry and is willing to connect you. The lectures were always engaging, tests were easy, prompts for essays were clear, great feedback given, and he was accessible outside of class. Highly recommend.

Awesome professor. Lots of connections from his field so there were a ton of guest lectures that really added a unique element to the class. He makes getting an A very doable and is very thorough in all the assignments and gives great feedback. Seems to really care about the students! Take a class with him if you get a chance for sure!

Very difficult course with weekly assignments to summarize lectures and near-weekly lab assignments. A lot of the material went over my head until I was able to contextualize it farther along in the course - he really just drops you right into it. But Jianzi is extremely knowledgeable about the material and very accessible outside of class.

The class had 4 quizzes a week (2 lecture, 2 reading). You could receive a 50% or 75% if you get one question wrong. About 3-4 readings a week over 20 pages per reading. You could only communicate with professor over a discussion board. Deadlines were at random times. Exam questions and answers were unnecessarily long. I don't recommend.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. I was so excited to take this class, however, she has deadlines at absurd times that do not make any sense, she gives you a lot of readings each week that re every difficult, and you get 2-3 quizzes on the readings each week. Nothing really good to say about this professor or class.

I think this is the worst class I have ever taken. She gave us so many quizzes at different weird times. The lectures are tough, frequently you have to read more than 20 pages of scanned paper to do just ONE QUIZ. There is just too much to complain about this class. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Reading quizzes are due before lectures so noon; post quizzes are due at midnight, other assignments are due at 9 PM; all of the deadlines are on different days so you basically have something due in the class every single day. Midterm was awful, class average was 16/30. Too much work for an intro class, material is hard to understand and boring
